If the spell requires a spell attack roll, use the result of your ranged attack roll with the ammunition to determine the degree of success of the spell. If the spell requires a saving throw, the target attempts the save against your spell DC.

The maximum level of spell the ammunition can hold determines its item level and Price.

Activate D Cast a Spell

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gKKqvLohtrSJj3BM]{Magic Missile} 1st
sjXOUlhh7Alii1i5.name: Spellstrike Ammunition (Type I) (Magic Missile)

4QRkjb5aTrVTZYRO.description:
Trigger A creature plays an instrument while Casting a Spell or casts a composition spell within 20 feet of the dreadsong dancer

Effect The dreadsong dancer Strides up to 20 feet and makes a songblade Strike against the triggering creature. If the Strike hits, the spell is disrupted.
4QRkjb5aTrVTZYRO.name: Jealous Musician

8K2BcPcACmOHHydT.description:
The dreadsong dancer whirls their howling songblades and cloaks themself in illusion magic. Each non-fiend creature in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] from the dreadsong dancer must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:29] save.

Critical Success No effect, and the creature is temporarily immune for 24 hours. The dreadsong dancer is affected by their performance anxiety.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}, and the dreadsong dancer is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} by the creature for 1 minute. The creature can't use Seek to find the dreadsong dancer.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature can't reduce its frightened condition below 2 for 1 minute. In addition, the dreadsong dancer is affected by its performance anxiety.
8K2BcPcACmOHHydT.name: Dreadsong

cNdgAyzrxvT3Z68j.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Composition Spells

oaYvNv83OSKkOI6V.description:
A dreadsong dancer is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} if they see or hear a creature critically succeed at a Performance check or at a saving throw against their Dreadsong.

The dreadsong dancer is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened 1} for 1 round if they see or hear a creature critically fail at a Performance check or a saving throw against their Dreadsong.

They can use the extra action only to Stride or Strike.
oaYvNv83OSKkOI6V.name: Performance Anxiety

Dreadsong Dancer.name: Dreadsong Dancer
Dreadsong Dancer.npcAllSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. composition spells

INFGwX7PUOvEy0iD.description:
The eberark Strides twice, leaving a trail of magical fire behind it as it moves. Squares the eberark moves through catch fire, creating a 5-foot-tall wall of flame that burns for 1 round. The wall of flame conceals creatures and objects on the other side of it.

Any creature that enters or starts its turn in the wall of flame takes @Damage[6d6[fire]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:27|basic:true] save).
INFGwX7PUOvEy0iD.name: Trail of Flame

vvMB5rLp5hejSAmy.description:
The eberark utters crude insults and growls threateningly. Each creature within 30 feet must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:27] save.

The creature is then temporarily immune for 10 minutes.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 4} and paralyzed for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.
vvMB5rLp5hejSAmy.name: Arrogant Taunts

wtewhF2XR7w6V0Wm.description:
A creature hit by the eberark's spit becomes coated in a slippery, flammable oil.

The creature must succeed at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:27] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for as long as they are coated in incendiary spit.

Creatures affected by incendiary spit that take fire damage catch fire, taking @Damage[3d6[persistent,fire]] damage. Once this persistent fire damage ends, the spit has burned away.
wtewhF2XR7w6V0Wm.name: Incendiary Spit

MIGvbijvRTovVpJE.description: The excorion spews necrotic blood all over a foe it has grabbed. The grabbed creature must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:25] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.
MIGvbijvRTovVpJE.name: Vomit Blood

OfYcuvZbwxbjF6cG.description: The excorion moves about by way of hundreds of pulsating blood vessels, which stretch from its body in dozens of tight, ropy bundles and anchor it to the ground. An excorion cannot be Tripped, Shoved, or otherwise forcibly moved except by magic, and the excorion ignores difficult terrain (but not greater difficult terrain).
OfYcuvZbwxbjF6cG.name: Vein Walker

qCVeUkgwYXq7lu8z.description: The excorion plants a magical handprint on the target, marking them as chosen for death. The excorion makes a fist Strike against an adjacent creature; this does not count toward the excorion's multiple attack penalty. On a hit, the attack does no damage, but the creature becomes observed to every excorion within 60 feet, even if an excorion's line of sight would be blocked by a wall or other obstacle. This effect lasts until the handprint is washed off, which requires water and spending 3 actions to fully clean off.
qCVeUkgwYXq7lu8z.name: Bloody Handprint

yTV624ydUotNS7Qa.description:
Requirements The excorion has at least 70 Hit Points

Effect The excorion sacrifices itself and transfers its bloody, vital energy to a willing living creature within 30 feet. The excorion is immediately destroyed, and the targeted living creature heals a number of HP equal to half the excorion's remaining HP at the time that it used this ability.

The living creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} during its next turn as its body adjusts to the newly transfused blood and vital energy; the living creature also counts as an excorion for 1 minute for the purpose of seeing other excorions' Bloody Handprint marks.
yTV624ydUotNS7Qa.name: Vital Transfusion

1d7P7fxvDCam2ALx.description:
The excorion moves about by way of hundreds of pulsating blood vessels, which stretch from its body in dozens of tight, ropy bundles and anchor it to the ground.

An excorion can't be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Tripped}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shoved}, or otherwise forcibly moved except by magic, and the excorion ignores difficult terrain (but not greater difficult terrain).
1d7P7fxvDCam2ALx.name: Vein Walker

Kp4jOhCQVcuNVP2j.description:
Requirements The excorion has at least 200 Hit Points

Effect The excorion sacrifices itself and transfers its bloody, vital energy to a willing living creature within 30 feet. The excorion is immediately destroyed, and the targeted living creature heals a number of HP equal to half the excorion's remaining HP at the time that it used this ability.

The living creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} during its next turn as its body adjusts to the newly transfused blood and vital energy.
Kp4jOhCQVcuNVP2j.name: Vital Transfusion

oOj2D6OXRFRGfvRp.description:
The excorion spews necrotic blood all over a foe it has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}.

The grabbed creature must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:39] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.
oOj2D6OXRFRGfvRp.name: Vomit Blood

s6jGCfKSGTptJo1G.description:
The excorion paragon projects a mist of burning blood in a @Template[type:cone|distance:10].

Creatures in the area take @Damage[10d8[acid]] damage and @Damage[5d8[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:37|basic:true] save).

On a failed save, an affected creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round (or 2 rounds on a critical failure).

The excorion can't use Blinding Bile again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Blinding Bile]]{1d4 rounds}.
s6jGCfKSGTptJo1G.name: Blinding Bile

Exploding Statue.description: A hollow statue filled with explosives is connected to a trip wire running along the adjacent door.
Exploding Statue.hazardDisable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:21|name:Safely Cut Wire|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) to safely cut the wire
Exploding Statue.name: Exploding Statue

Explosive Barrels.description: Wooden barrels marked with an oil-drop symbol catch fire and explode.
Explosive Barrels.hazardDisable: @Check[type:survival|dc:20|name:Smother the Flames] to smother the flames without rupturing the barrels
Explosive Barrels.name: Explosive Barrels

Eyeball Tank.description: A vat of thick glass stands 10 feet high and is filled with green slime and fist-sized eyeballs.
Eyeball Tank.hazardDisable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:38|name:Acidify Slime|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) or @Check[type:crafting|dc:34|name:Acidify Slime] (expert) to acidify the slime inside the tank, destroying the eyeballs
Eyeball Tank.hazardRoutine: (3 actions) Each round, the vat uses all three of its actions to shoot random eye rays at any living creatures (except Ixusoth) in range.
Eyeball Tank.name: Eyeball Tank

False Door Trap.description: A hidden needle delivers a magical poison to anyone trying to open the door.
False Door Trap.hazardDisable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:32|name:Jam Needle in Housing|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to jam the needle in its housing or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (6th level, counteract DC 30) to dispel the magical poison.
False Door Trap.name: False Door Trap

0Jid4uAhNoUlXWoo.description:
Whenever Fayati critically succeeds at a Strike against a creature, until the start of her next turn, the first time that another member of the Copper Hand deals damage to that creature during their turn, they deal an additional 1d6 precision damage to it.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.dVVc5MYx4G3QPHoa]{Effect: Guildmaster's Lead}
0Jid4uAhNoUlXWoo.name: Guildmaster's Lead

4mfr0BXdQQ9ZuRDr.description:
Requirements Fayati's last attack was a successful melee Strike with her rapier

Effect Fayati makes a main-gauche Strike against the same creature that she just hit. This Strike deals an additional 4d6 precision damage.
4mfr0BXdQQ9ZuRDr.name: Deepen the Wound

LHiVjvx4vjJjet1C.description:
Activate1 Interact

After you drink this elixir, your sight becomes sharper in darkness. You gain darkvision for 1 hour.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.bcxVvIbuZWOvsKcA]{Effect: Darkvision Elixir (Moderate)}

QDbM7WGGXh21h9Xw.description:
Trigger A creature targets Fayati with an attack and she can see the attacker

Effect Fayati dodges out of the way, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.
QDbM7WGGXh21h9Xw.name: Nimble Dodge

SriOV0CxqQFmpPCv.description: Fayati deals 2d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

WCFZ8IEU5wGPGAZK.description:
Trigger A creature within Fayati's reach is hit by a melee Strike from one of her allies

Effect Fayati makes a Strike against the triggering creature.
WCFZ8IEU5wGPGAZK.name: Opportune Backstab

Field Of Opposition.description: A distortion in space spawns an aggressive, malevolent shadow duplicate of any characters who pass between Terimor's faces.
Field Of Opposition.hazardDisable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:42|name:Disable Thievery] (legendary) to permanently disable the planar distortion (DC increases by 2 for each duplicate still extant), or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (10th level; counteract DC 42) to destroy the planar distortion
Field Of Opposition.name: Field Of Opposition

Flying Guillotine.description: An invisible magical glyph on the guillotine's blade detects living creatures in the room, which causes the guillotine to fly off its hinges and attack.
Flying Guillotine.hazardDisable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:20|name:Erase Glyph|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) to erase the glyph (which requires a successful unarmed attack roll if the blade is already active) or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (3rd level; counteract DC 20) to counteract it. The trap has a secret bypass known only to Ralso and Pratchett: as long as the guillotine can see a creature in the room touching thumb and pinky together with an empty hand, it remains dormant.
Flying Guillotine.hazardReset: After 1 minute, the trap deactivates, though the door remains locked. The trap rearms itself each day at dawn.
Flying Guillotine.hazardRoutine: (1 action) The blade @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cS9nfDRGD83bNU1p]{Flies} up to 20 feet and Strikes any creatures whose squares it passes through. It cannot target the same creature more than once per round. The blade cannot be grappled and doesn't take a multiple attack penalty.
Flying Guillotine.name: Flying Guillotine

GrbNOULOdg2VBphU.description: Franca's Strikes deal an additional 3d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

LQEhpFQTxwqQ8b2q.description:
Trigger The attack roll for a Strike targeting Franca fails or critically fails

Effect Franca can choose to either Step or redirect the attack to a creature that is adjacent to her and within the reach of the triggering attack.

The attacker rerolls the Strike's attack roll against the new target.
LQEhpFQTxwqQ8b2q.name: Deflective Dodge

N7tigM3cgdlHJfqp.description: A piece of shining ammunition gives off a faint glow. When shot, this ammunition sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius (and dim light to the next 20 feet) for 10 minutes. If it hits a target, it sticks, causing the target to shed light in the same radius. A creature can remove the ammunition with an Interact action, but the ammunition itself continues to glow for the rest of the duration or until destroyed.
N7tigM3cgdlHJfqp.name: Shining Bolt

PzYFpkZAo1pAeUoo.description:
Activate2Interact

This oily, dark purple powder gives off the distinct odor of boiled leather. When delivered, the poison acts quickly to constrict the victim's blood flow to their extremities and turn their lungs into a soft jelly. A victim of blackfinger blight is recognizable by the pores of their fingertips weeping an inky oil that coats their hands and makes it difficult to hold things. Each round, at the beginning of their turn, a creature affected by blackfinger blight must succeed at a flat DC 5 check or drop one random item they're holding.

Saving Throw DC 32 Fortitude

Onset 1 round

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[6d6[poison]] damage (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[8d6[poison]] damage (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[10d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused}(1 round)

XVBhNwitUtia7zY6.name: +2 Circumstance Bonus on Saves vs. Poison

lVvJa2dDy1MeSjQ1.description:
Franca uncorks and flings a dose of poison at a bleeding foe.

She retrieves a poison from her inventory, then splashes it at a creature within 10 feet that is currently taking @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Bleed Damage}.

The creature must succeed at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:32] save or be exposed to the poison.
lVvJa2dDy1MeSjQ1.name: Splash Poison

oKdyZTnDb5xbqpF3.description:
Requirements Franca's last action was a melee Strike that dealt sneak attack damage to an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} target

Effect Franca deals @Damage[6[bleed]] damage to the target creature, and the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}.
oKdyZTnDb5xbqpF3.name: Hamstring

udFVDwS0vDvYW3tw.description:
Franca quickly slashes at nearby foes, aiming to maim rather than disable. She makes up to three melee Strikes, each against a different creature within reach.

These Strikes count toward Franca's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after all three Strikes are made.

On a hit, the Strike deals @Damage[3[bleed]] damage instead of its normal damage.

On a critical hit, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the beginning of Franca's next turn or until they spend an action to remove the condition, whichever comes first.
udFVDwS0vDvYW3tw.name: Bloody Rebel

Franca Laurentz.name: Franca Laurentz
Franca Laurentz.npcAllSaves: +2 circumstance bonus to saves vs. poison

Freezing Alarm.description: Miniature snowflake-shaped glyphs on the ground cause a layer of ice to ripple over the floor of the room and sound a silent alarm.
Freezing Alarm.hazardDisable: @Check[type:arcana|dc:53|name:Disable Arcana] (legendary) to draw a fiery counteracting glyph over each snowflake, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (9th level, counteract DC 48)
Freezing Alarm.name: Freezing Alarm

0KI7dYfaduuCOAlE.description:
When Frefferth is destroyed, his body and items dissipate into shadowy nothingness and the knight re-forms after [[/br 1d4 #days]]{1d4 days} within the sarcophagus in area D12, fully healed.

Frefferth can be trapped only by returning the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.6MIBHKMJmD8uQVam]{Chain of the Stilled Spirit} to the sarcophagus (see areas D12 and D34), in which case Frefferth's body dissipates, leaving his items in the spot where he was last slain.
0KI7dYfaduuCOAlE.name: Rejuvenation

SEDzDCcVcLItgSUy.description:
Frefferth removes the head of a dead creature within reach.

Each creature within the area of Frefferth's frightful presence must attempt a new save, even if they are temporarily immune.
SEDzDCcVcLItgSUy.name: Reap

YDAmsDKjMjg1NU8x.description:
Any slashing weapon a dullahan wields becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.hg3IogR8ue2IWwgS]{Keen}, and any hatchet it wields becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.qlunQzfnzPQpMG6U]{Returning}.

If the dullahan kills a creature with a critical hit using a slashing weapon, the target is decapitated as though the dullahan had used Reap on the target.

These effects remain only while the dullahan holds the weapon.
YDAmsDKjMjg1NU8x.name: Head Hunter

odph4tUxJEzbuuiq.description:
Whenever Frefferth damages a creature with a critical hit using a ranged piercing weapon, the weapon remains impaled in the victim's body.

The victim becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} as long as they are impaled; the impaling weapon can be removed by the affected creature or an adjacent ally as a 2-action activity that has the manipulate trait.
odph4tUxJEzbuuiq.name: Impaler

yzD6DHeUdHo1tXNp.description:
Frefferth summons a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.waPgKbjhijeZ00Zm]{Nightmare}.

This steed remains until it is slain, Frefferth @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.AjLSHZSWQ90exdLo]{Dismisses} it, or Frefferth summons another steed.
yzD6DHeUdHo1tXNp.name: Summon Steed

35yXdy43dCClA3wy.description:
When Gage meets a group of up to five people, he can immediately attempt a Diplomacy check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression}, comparing the result to the Will DC of each target.

He takes a -3 penalty on this check, and it is possible to get different degrees of success for each target. If he fails or critically fails, he can engage in 1 minute of conversation and attempt a new check at the end of that time rather than accepting the failure or critical failure result.
35yXdy43dCClA3wy.name: Smooth Operator

HNYjS5WAb54frbpw.description:
When Gage gets a critical success using the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ewwCglB7XOPLUz72]{Lie} action, the target's attitude toward him improves by one step, as though he'd succeeded at using Diplomacy to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression}.

This works only once per conversation, and if he critically succeeds against multiple targets using the same result, he chooses one creature's attitude to improve.

To use this ability, Gage must be lying to impart seemingly important information, inflate his status, or ingratiate himself, which trivial or irrelevant lies can't achieve.
HNYjS5WAb54frbpw.name: Charming Liar

ZbNsjTdTl9JRvGxk.description: Whenever the gang tough makes a successful melee Strike against a frightened creature, the Strike deals an extra weapon die of damage.
ZbNsjTdTl9JRvGxk.name: Bullyrag Beatdown

aZvRC9a03MwZf7rr.description: When the gang tough's Strike with a bludgeoning weapon is a critical hit and deals damage, the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.
aZvRC9a03MwZf7rr.name: Frightening Critical

MjTG6JP6vMA8bV3d.description: The master assassin deals an additional 3d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

NCSmuA0MRlQynOaO.description: This ranged weapon has a bow-like assembly mounted on a handled frame called a tiller. The tiller has a mechanism to lock the bowstring in place, attached to a trigger mechanism that releases the tension and launches a bolt.
NCSmuA0MRlQynOaO.name: +2 Striking Crossbow

SMg5BMoXiwN9nxmJ.description: The master assassin Strides, Steps, or Sneaks, then Interacts to reload her crossbow.
SMg5BMoXiwN9nxmJ.name: Running Reload

Uxhs2XTuVqdcp4Iu.description: This leather armor is reinforced with metal studs and sometimes small metal plates, providing most of the flexibility of leather armor with more robust protection.
Uxhs2XTuVqdcp4Iu.name: +2 Resilient Studded Leather Armor

jQNdJLLudvCqQFJq.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.
jQNdJLLudvCqQFJq.name: +2 Striking Dagger

mRPwn3ixbA1j5Wfz.description: The master assassin observes a single target she can see, allowing her to use her Vorpal Garrote during the next round.
mRPwn3ixbA1j5Wfz.name: Study Target

o1pfLDPNAQy8FT0p.description: The master assassin makes a crossbow Strike against an adjacent enemy; unlike most ranged Strikes, this Strike doesn't provoke reactions. If successful, the attack deals an additional 4d8 precision damage.
o1pfLDPNAQy8FT0p.name: Point Blank

uIpZm7bCNAs8c7BV.description:
Requirements The master assassin used Study Target during the previous round and must have a garrote bolt

Effect The master assassin makes a crossbow Strike against the target she previously studied. If she rolls a success on her attack roll, she gets a critical success instead. The target must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:36|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Success No additional effect.

Failure The target takes an additional 3d12 precision damage.

Critical Failure The target is decapitated and instantly dies unless it doesn't require a head to live.
uIpZm7bCNAs8c7BV.name: Vorpal Garrote

wuytt71AuRJcaryt.description:
Trigger The attack roll for a Strike targeting the assassin fails or critically fails

Effect The assassin deftly steps out of the way of the attack. If there's another creature adjacent to the assassin and within reach of the triggering attack, the assassin redirects the attack to that adjacent creature. The attacker then rerolls the Strike's attack roll against the new target.
wuytt71AuRJcaryt.name: Sidestep

Gas Trap.description: A spring slams and locks the room's door before four hidden gas vents begin pumping poison gas into the chamber.
Gas Trap.hazardDisable: Four @Check[type:thievery|dc:20|name:Block Gas Vents|traits:action:disable-a-device] checks to block the gas vents, or a @Check[type:thievery|dc:26|name:Unlock Door|traits:action:pick-a-lock] check to unlock the door and escape
Gas Trap.hazardReset: The trap must be manually rearmed by unblocking the vents or replacing the poison gas tank in area E30.
Gas Trap.hazardRoutine:
(1 action) Each round on its initiative count, the trap pumps more toxic gas into the room.

Any breathing creature in the room takes @Damage[4d6[poison]] damage (a successful @Check[type:fortitude|dc:22|traits:poison,damaging-effect] save halves the damage taken). If a creature acts before the trap on the first round, it has the option of holding its breath to postpone taking damage from the trap-holding one's breath after the trap's first action has no effect, since the air in the creature's lungs is already tainted. Locating and blocking one of the hidden gas vents reduces the poison damage by 1d6-if all four are blocked, the trap is disabled, though the door remains locked. Otherwise, the trap functions for 1 minute before all the gas is expended and characters in the room cease taking damage, after which the trap ventilates the room for 1 additional minute.
Gas Trap.name: Gas Trap

29elTy7XDcAju8yK.description:
When a ghaele fixes their gaze upon a non-good creature, the creature is subjected to the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.sX2o0HH4RjJDAZ8C]{Divine Decree} (@Check[type:will|dc:20|name:Divine Decree|traits:damaging-effect] save).

If it survives, the creature is temporarily immune to for 1 minute.
29elTy7XDcAju8yK.name: Ghaele's Gaze

A8r84vdl4zcvpCMg.description:
Trigger The ghaele ends its turn while unable to act or attempts a greatsword Strike that would take a circumstance or status penalty.

Effect A ghaele's blade is implacable in the pursuit of freedom, and its energies can overpower any effect that would interfere with its swordplay.

The ghaele attempts to counteract each effect that prevents it from making a greatsword Strike, gives it a penalty to its greatsword Strike, or prevents it from acting.

The ghaele can use this ability even if it's otherwise unable to act.
A8r84vdl4zcvpCMg.name: Free Blade

Gv8gIlACS3hfoYJF.description: Any weapon becomes a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.rvItjGQaYT7Luwtm]{+3} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.DH0kB9Wbr5pDeunX]{Holy} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.KCQRFvUgbyclvOGi]{Greater Striking} weapon while the ghaele wields it.
Gv8gIlACS3hfoYJF.name: Greater Holy Blade

Tfnx5jxpKaKtZ7ES.description:
A ghaele attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} about a foe they are facing.

If successful, they can change the elemental damage dealt by their greatsword and light ray to acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic, usually to match the foe's weakness.

They can also change their energy resistance to any of these energy types (this can be a different type than for their attacks).

The choices remain until they next use Choose Weakness.
Tfnx5jxpKaKtZ7ES.name: Choose Weakness

nqhGLlFeLoFFBN9g.description:
A ghaele's body is partially corporeal and partially composed of light, with a color corresponding to the elemental energy currently residing in its blade (see Choose Weakness).

It can move through solid objects but can't end its action within a solid object.
nqhGLlFeLoFFBN9g.name: Light Form

H2cjvx6x95qaiQFo.description:
Marrow rot affects only creatures with a skeletal system

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:25|traits:disease]

Onset 1 day

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 day)
H2cjvx6x95qaiQFo.name: Marrow Rot

Ptf4oQIP2T6623QL.description: The giant bone skipper @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.d5I6018Mci2SWokk]{Leaps} up to 20 feet. It then makes a mandibles Strike, gaining a +1 circumstance bonus to its attack roll.
Ptf4oQIP2T6623QL.name: Leaping Charge

yX6VKlUamzU5KOQr.description: A giant bone skipper identifies bones and creatures with a skeletal system in the listed range.
yX6VKlUamzU5KOQr.name: Bonesense (Imprecise) 30 feet

BofxZCq1wekuufql.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:25]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d8[poison]] (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d8[poison]] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[1d8[poison]] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} (1 round)

Stage 4 @Damage[2d8[poison]] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} ([[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds})
BofxZCq1wekuufql.name: Joro Spider Venom

vZXFIePI3zP2Og1M.description: A creature hit by the joro spider's web Strike is immobilized and stuck to the nearest surface until it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escapes} (DC 25).
vZXFIePI3zP2Og1M.name: Web Trap

T4zHj7DFiaCBwf6f.description: The gloaming will-o'-wisp extinguishes their hypnotic glow, becoming invisible. They can end this effect with another use of this action. If they use their shock attack while invisible, the arc of electricity lets any observer determine their location, making the will-o'-wisp only hidden to observers until they move.
T4zHj7DFiaCBwf6f.name: Go Dark

Vy9EtFybJQqo55xn.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

Similar to other will-o'-wisps, a gloaming will-o'-wisp is naturally invisible, but glows with a faint colored light. They cast dim light in the aura, which makes them visible. In addition, any non-aberration creature that ends their turn in the aura and can see the gloaming will-o'-wisp is distracted by the gloaming will-o'-wisp's glow and must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:31] save. On a failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round and takes @Damage[3d6[mental]] damage.
Vy9EtFybJQqo55xn.name: Hypnotic Glow

Yb2OjQReLk3HgLoc.description:
Requirement An enemy is under a fear effect or dying within 15 feet of the will-o'-wisp

Effect The will-o'-wisp feeds on the creature's terror. They regains 4d8 Hit Points, and if they've Gone Dark, their glow reignites. A will-o'-wisp can take this action only once per round.
Yb2OjQReLk3HgLoc.name: Feed on Fear

yAHJOd3dkfOae1Kf.description: A will-o'-wisp is immune to all spells except faerie fire, glitterdust, magic missile, and maze.
yAHJOd3dkfOae1Kf.name: Magic Immunity

53IhzCwi4y8yO9XX.description:
Frequency 7 times per day

Requirements Grabble hasn't acted yet on this turn

Effect Grabble can cast one prepared spell he has already cast today without spending a spell slot. He must still Cast the Spell and meet the spell's other requirements. He can do this once per day for each of the spell levels he can cast.
53IhzCwi4y8yO9XX.name: Drain Bonded Item

NILfejzFJ409TN4i.description:
Frequency 3 times per day

Effect If Grabble's next action is to cast a cantrip or a spell that is 6th level or lower and deals acid, cold, electricity, or fire damage, the spell deals poison damage rather than its normal damage type and gains the poison trait.
NILfejzFJ409TN4i.name: Poison Conversion

Grabble Forden.name: Grabble Forden
Grabble Forden.npcAllSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Fm6lAJIPw6ObpzHZ.description:
Requirements A creature within 60 feet of Graem or Grinlowe is in contact with the waters of Stormholt

Effect The hag casts maze (DC 37) on the creature, magically pulling the creature beneath the water (regardless of its actual depth) into an extradimensional underwater maze of shipwrecks. Between the two of them, Graem and Grinlowe can have only one creature trapped in the maze, but either hag can use the Sustain a Spell action to sustain the effect.
Fm6lAJIPw6ObpzHZ.name: Pull Under

YzsKsO21XfN1KAry.description:
The hag gazes upon a creature, afflicting it with intense distress and a gnawing sense of impending doom, with a result depending on its Will save (DC 37). The target does not need to be able to see the sea hag.

Critical Success No effect.

Success @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round. If the target was dying, it remains unconscious for 1 day. At the end of the day, it must attempt a Fortitude save against the same DC; if it fails, it dies.

Critical Failure @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 minute. If the target was dying, it remains unconscious for 1 day. At the end of the day, it must attempt a Fortitude save against the same DC; if it fails, it dies.
YzsKsO21XfN1KAry.name: Dread Gaze

byUSs0eF5Ctqs4xY.description: The sea hag can make a bargain with a willing creature, who must be of sound mind. The creature gives away a special or cherished quality-such as its courage, its beauty, or its voice-in exchange for a boon or a promise from the sea hag. As long as the sea hag keeps her end of the bargain, the only way to restore the lost quality is to defeat the sea hag or make another bargain for its return.
byUSs0eF5Ctqs4xY.name: Sea Hag's Bargain

deQl75TOphyii6YU.description: As long as at least one other member of Myrna's coven is on the demiplane of Stormholt, the coven members add chain lightning, lightning bolt, plane shift, and punishing winds to their spells, each of which can be cast at up to 8th level.
deQl75TOphyii6YU.name: Planar Coven

0rqwxWSqNK0Ikmdw.description:
This curse affects anyone who wears a graveknight's armor for at least 1 hour

Saving Throw @Check[type:will|dc:43|traits:curse] save

Onset 1 hour

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} and can't remove the armor (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 2}, hampered 10, and can't remove the armor (1 day)

Stage 3 dies and transforms into the armor's graveknight
0rqwxWSqNK0Ikmdw.name: Graveknight's Curse

1GcnjXs1m3fitCxq.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

When a creature in the aura uses a positive spell or ability, the graveknight automatically attempts to counteract it, with a +27 counteract modifier.
1GcnjXs1m3fitCxq.name: Sacrilegious Aura

A6srN9riF7cII1ek.description: This large battle axe is too heavy to wield with only one hand. Many greataxes incorporate two blades, and they are often "bearded," having a hook at the bottom to increase the strength of their chopping power.

N5zf8LJKXg8KdskQ.description:
The graveknight carves the sigil of Kharnas onto an adjacent @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} creature.

As long as the creature bears the sigil of Kharnas, it takes a -2 status penalty to saving throws against the abilities of any creature that previously served Kharnas, but it can also freely pass through any hazards that can be bypassed by those bearing the sigil of Kharnas, such as Kharnas's glyphs.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.St2QzqQvKN0IaXxG]{Effect: Kharna's Blessing}
N5zf8LJKXg8KdskQ.name: Kharnas's Blessing

OqEu80bVGGZXPfVs.description:
The graveknight unleashes a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] of energy.

Creatures in the area take @Damage[10d12[fire]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:37|basic:true] save).

The graveknight can't use this ability again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Devastating Blast]]{1d4 rounds}.
OqEu80bVGGZXPfVs.name: Devastating Blast

bLsJ5WlwMamd2QGg.description:
When a graveknight is destroyed, its armor rebuilds its body over the course of [[/br 1d10 #days]] days-or more quickly if the armor is worn by a living host. If the body is destroyed before then, the process restarts.

A graveknight can only be permanently destroyed by obliterating its armor (such as with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.r7ihOgKv19eJQnik]{Disintegrate}), transporting it to the Positive Energy Plane, or throwing it into the heart of a volcano.
bLsJ5WlwMamd2QGg.name: Rejuvenation

bqTN2IAncaogzgo9.description: The graveknight has access to the critical specialization effects of any weapons it wields.
bqTN2IAncaogzgo9.name: Weapon Master

Greater Planar Rift.description: A ragged planar rift drags things into its depths and hurls creatures through from its terminal end.
Greater Planar Rift.hazardDisable: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (9th level; counteract DC 46) to seal the rift
Greater Planar Rift.name: Greater Planar Rift

5hCSuILSsdP2wKtN.description: A ratfolk has stretchy cheek pouches that can store up to 1 cubic foot of objects. The ratfolk can remove or store an item using the Interact action. As long as the ratfolk has at least one object in its cheek pouches, its speech is noticeably difficult to understand.
5hCSuILSsdP2wKtN.name: Cheek Pouches

hrbhUgMW0KZvWovb.description: Gref has trained extensively with the katar blade. Any katar he wields gains the finesse trait.
hrbhUgMW0KZvWovb.name: Katar Specialist

mjEOGwxDnDNV6VB0.description:
A ratfolk can end its movement in the same square as an ally that also has this ability.

Only two such creatures can share the same space.
mjEOGwxDnDNV6VB0.name: Swarming

viGvtlLGXHhsAVh8.description:
Frequency once per round.

Effect Gref stores one held item of light or negligible Bulk in his cheek pouches.
viGvtlLGXHhsAVh8.name: Quick Stow

UUw22Ccx1nqHZgFR.description: Any creature a grick critically hits is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against its attacks until the end of the grick's next turn.
UUw22Ccx1nqHZgFR.name: Unbalancing Blow

YXf0epw5INfNsVTi.description: When a grick takes a Stride action to move half its Speed or less, that movement doesn't trigger reactions.
YXf0epw5INfNsVTi.name: Vermicular Movement

8mxc9kYnnRowCRTO.description: Longswords can be one-edged or two-edged swords. Their blades are heavy and they're between 3 and 4 feet in length.
8mxc9kYnnRowCRTO.name: +2 Greater Striking Longsword

AhIWKC4vtlgBb9Ah.description: This small wooden box contains cosmetics, false facial hair, spirit gum, and a few simple wigs. You usually need a disguise kit to set up a disguise in order to Impersonate someone using the Deception skill. An elite disguise kit adds a +1 item bonus to relevant checks. If you've crafted a large number of disguises, you can replenish your cosmetics supply with replacement cosmetics suitable for the type of your disguise kit.
AhIWKC4vtlgBb9Ah.name: Disguise Kit (Elite)

I5UOcgBhEV16sOvv.description: Grimwold studies his foe for weaknesses to exploit. His next successful Strike against that target deals an additional 4d6 precision damage.
I5UOcgBhEV16sOvv.name: Studied Strike

rMKwSTFsZNjo251o.description: As long as he has one free hand, Grimwold can parry attacks against him with his longsword. He gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of his next turn as long as his other hand remains free.
rMKwSTFsZNjo251o.name: Dueling Parry

Fm6lAJIPw6ObpzHZ.description:
Requirements A creature within 60 feet of Graem or Grinlowe is in contact with the waters of Stormholt

Effect The hag casts maze (DC 37) on the creature, magically pulling the creature beneath the water (regardless of its actual depth) into an extradimensional underwater maze of shipwrecks. Between the two of them, Graem and Grinlowe can have only one creature trapped in the maze, but either hag can use the Sustain a Spell action to sustain the effect.
Fm6lAJIPw6ObpzHZ.name: Pull Under

YzsKsO21XfN1KAry.description:
The hag gazes upon a creature, afflicting it with intense distress and a gnawing sense of impending doom, with a result depending on its Will save (DC 37). The target does not need to be able to see the sea hag.

Critical Success No effect.

Success @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round. If the target was dying, it remains unconscious for 1 day. At the end of the day, it must attempt a Fortitude save against the same DC; if it fails, it dies.

Critical Failure @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 minute. If the target was dying, it remains unconscious for 1 day. At the end of the day, it must attempt a Fortitude save against the same DC; if it fails, it dies.
YzsKsO21XfN1KAry.name: Dread Gaze

byUSs0eF5Ctqs4xY.description: The sea hag can make a bargain with a willing creature, who must be of sound mind. The creature gives away a special or cherished quality-such as its courage, its beauty, or its voice-in exchange for a boon or a promise from the sea hag. As long as the sea hag keeps her end of the bargain, the only way to restore the lost quality is to defeat the sea hag or make another bargain for its return.
byUSs0eF5Ctqs4xY.name: Sea Hag's Bargain

deQl75TOphyii6YU.description: As long as at least one other member of Myrna's coven is on the demiplane of Stormholt, the coven members add chain lightning, lightning bolt, plane shift, and punishing winds to their spells, each of which can be cast at up to 8th level.
deQl75TOphyii6YU.name: Planar Coven

GTs7sVH9yhH8mKkM.description:
Lavarsus has trained to take down suspects without killing them.

He can choose to make nonlethal attacks with any bludgeoning weapon without taking the usual penalty to his attack roll.
GTs7sVH9yhH8mKkM.name: Nonlethal Training

of0eB3PZMwreV0L4.description: Lavarsus adds double his Strength modifier to any nonlethal melee Strikes he makes with a bludgeoning weapon.
of0eB3PZMwreV0L4.name: Furious Pacifier

Grunka.description:
The frontline fighters of goblin tribes prefer to fight in large groups-especially when they can outnumber their foes at least three to one.

These small humanoids have green or gray skin and large heads with wide ears. While some goblins are civilized and have worked hard to be considered upstanding members of humanoid communities, most are impetuous and vicious creatures who delight in wreaking havoc. These goblins think nothing of slaughtering livestock, stealing infants, or burning down a building purely for momentary delight. They revel in playing malicious tricks on taller humanoids, whom they call "longshanks."

Goblins are superstitious, with an intense awe of magic and a fascination with fire; goblins who master magic or fire earn great respect from their kin. Most other humanoids find it difficult to understand goblins' outlook: they hate canines but eagerly share their lairs with so-called "goblin dogs," they fearlessly attack larger creatures but are terrified of horses, and they despise vegetables yet consider pickles a delicacy. To a goblin, of course, these are all perfectly sensible life choices.

32FbUxGNpWinXjEq.description:
Trigger A goblin ally ends a move action adjacent to Grunka.

Effect Grunka @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.UHpkTuCtyaPqiCAB]{Steps}.
32FbUxGNpWinXjEq.name: Goblin Scuttle

Grunka.name: Grunka

Hands Of The Forgotten.description: Ethereal hands stretch out from the walls and floor, attempting to restrain nearby creatures.
Hands Of The Forgotten.hazardDisable: @Check[type:religion|dc:30|name:Exorcise Spirits] (master) to exorcise the spirits or @Check[type:intimidation|dc:32|name:Scare Away the Hands|traits:action:demoralize] (expert) to scare away the hands
Hands Of The Forgotten.name: Hands Of The Forgotten

BeG2KYyzwrCfE6KK.description: Any creature struck and damaged by a hegessik's jaws Strike must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:36] save or be subject to a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.rollable-tables.RollTable.yRZwPolTnRdnz42V]{Warpwave}
BeG2KYyzwrCfE6KK.name: Warpwave Strike

CUYM17Clq1YTEBxz.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

A susurrus of distracting whispers and dilations in reality surround a hegessik.

When a non-protean ends its turn in the aura, it must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:33] save. If it fails, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round.
CUYM17Clq1YTEBxz.name: Maddening Whispers

NyD5wXkVBGB2Wu0I.description:
A hegessik's vital organs shift and change shape and position constantly. Immediately after the hegessik takes acid, electricity, or sonic damage, it gains the listed amount of resistance to that damage type. This lasts for 1 hour or until the next time the protean takes damage of one of the other types (in which case its resistance changes to match that type), whichever comes first.

The hegessik is immune to polymorph effects unless it is a willing target. If @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened}, the hegessik automatically recovers at the end of its next turn as new sensory organs grow to replace the compromised ones.
NyD5wXkVBGB2Wu0I.name: Protean Anatomy 20

XrrgRKZ5Cs3t7Wzc.description:
A hegessik can anticipate the most likely location of a creature through their supernatural insight into the forces of chaotic probabilities and chance. This grants the hegessik the ability to sense creatures within the listed range.

The hegessik's entropy sense doesn't detect creatures under the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.EoKBlgf6Smt8opaU]{Veil of Privacy} or that are otherwise shielded from divinations and predictions.
XrrgRKZ5Cs3t7Wzc.name: Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 60 feet

emBPB2m0d0BQpI2N.description:
The hegessik briefly opens its third eye.

Non-protean creatures in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:38] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 round (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3} on a critical failure).
emBPB2m0d0BQpI2N.name: Leaching Glare

fmyoJEwSeBRrb9Ik.name: +1 Status Bonus on Saves vs. Divine Magic

h8NOsLMsLkhSoPDm.description:
The hegessik takes the appearance of any Large or smaller creature. This doesn't change its Speed or its attack and damage bonuses with its Strikes, but might change the damage type its Strikes deal.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

oJWZY02OG1m5LrP6.description:
The hegessik manifests psychic versions of its natural attacks and makes a Strike with each of its jaws, claw, and tail, in any order. These Strikes have a reach of 60 feet.

These attacks count toward the hegessik's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after it makes all the attacks.
oJWZY02OG1m5LrP6.name: Telekinetic Reach

Hegessik.name: Hegessik
Hegessik.npcAllSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. divine magic

JQLaH8N9rTPhEzqj.description: Each round, Pratchett can Strike once with each component of a sword cane without incurring the usual multiple attack penalty. Subsequent attacks incur the multiple attack penalty as usual.
JQLaH8N9rTPhEzqj.name: Sword Cane Duelist

VNhWmP9iCwh5JnM0.description:
This venom erodes its target's defenses, aiding the spider in securing prey.

Activate D Interact (Injury)

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:21|name:Hunting Spider Venom]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d10[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d12[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}, and off-guard (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}, and off-guard (1 round)
VNhWmP9iCwh5JnM0.name: Hunting Spider Venom (in Reaper's Lancet)

c9xP7D2JUcu3WRuz.description:
This small pendant is usually shaped like a humanoid skull or small animal skull.

Activate 3 Interact

Frequency three times per day

Effect You become undetectable to undead creatures for 10 minutes. Undead can't see, hear, or smell you, nor detect you with sensory capabilities such as scent or tremorsense. A creature can attempt a single DC 18 Will saving throw to ignore this effect. If an undead has reason to believe that undetected opponents are present, it can still attempt to Seek or Strike you. If you attempt to use a positive spell to damage undead, use Command Undead, touch or damage an undead creature, or attack any creature while warded in this manner, the pendant's effects immediately end. An undead creature who observes you in this manner or one who succeeds at the Will save is immune to the corpseward pendant for 24 hours.

0tqsvUhGYvPuB2ga.description: When Hestriviniaas casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.HBJPsonQnWcC3qdX]{Hallucinatory Terrain}, it infuses the illusion with quasi-real substance. Creatures that do not disbelieve the illusion treat structures and terrain created through the spell as though they were real, ascending illusory stairs, becoming trapped by illusory quicksand, and so on.
0tqsvUhGYvPuB2ga.name: Reshape Reality

4Wo8cEyKXFYXahnb.description:
Hestriviniaas can anticipate the most likely presence of a creature through a supernatural insight into chaotic probabilities and chance. This grants it the ability to sense creatures within the listed range.

A creature under the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.EoKBlgf6Smt8opaU]{Veil of Privacy} or that is otherwise shielded from divinations and predictions cannot be noticed via entropy sense.
4Wo8cEyKXFYXahnb.name: Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 60 feet

79KeB3EaNuz3Wjd2.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

A creature using a teleportation ability within the aura or arriving in it via teleportation must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:45] save or wink out of existence for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} before completing the teleport. The creature can't act, sense anything, or be targeted. On a successful save, the creature completes the teleport normally but is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Keketars are immune to this effect.
79KeB3EaNuz3Wjd2.name: Spatial Riptide

laNWVOBt5DoTHn3G.description: A creature struck by Hestriviniaas' jaws or claw Strike must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:45|traits:polmorph] save or be subject to a @RollTable[cBHMpmeIhoBdUyQT]{Warpwave}.
laNWVOBt5DoTHn3G.name: Warpwave Strike

nO9dKSqf8ZjJRuCy.description:
Hestriviniaas can take the appearance of any Gargantuan or smaller creature. This doesn't change its Speed or its attack and damage bonuses with its Strikes, but might change the damage type its Strikes deal.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

wKQPyzZESm0w8vni.description:
Hestriviniaas' vital organs shift and change shape and position constantly. Immediately after the Hestriviniaas takes acid, electricity, or sonic damage, it gains the listed amount of resistance to that damage type.

This lasts for 1 hour or until the next time the protean takes damage of one of the other types (in which case its resistance changes to match that type), whichever comes first. The keketar is immune to polymorph effects unless it is a willing target.

If @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened}, the keketar automatically recovers at the end of its next turn as new sensory organs grow to replace the compromised ones.
wKQPyzZESm0w8vni.name: Protean Anatomy

Hestriviniaas.name: Hestriviniaas
Hestriviniaas.npcAllSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Hidden Chute.description: A trapdoor in the floor conceals a stone chute.
Hidden Chute.hazardDisable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:20|name:Remove Trapdoor|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) to remove the trapdoor or lock it in position using a catch hidden inside the room's doorframe
Hidden Chute.name: Hidden Chute

DOYd8fquer3sIStG.description:
Trigger A creature attempts to target the hundun with a mental effect

Effect The triggering creature is subject to the utter chaos of the hundun's mind and must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:40|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes @Damage[10d6[mental]] damage.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[10d6[mental]] damage, is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 minute.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}.
DOYd8fquer3sIStG.name: Entropic Feedback

HLhPjN1be3uh5emL.description: The hundun makes two Strikes with its fist. If both hit the same creature, combine their damage for the purpose of resistances and weaknesses.
HLhPjN1be3uh5emL.name: Flurry of Blows

U1E1Xka1zLQxC4tT.description:
The hundun releases its staff-like attractor, which hovers in place. The hundun can use an action, which has the concentrate trait, to move the attractor up to 60 feet, to a maximum of 300 feet from the hundun. It can also use an action, which has the concentrate trait, to recall the attractor, which flies to the hundun and immediately deactivates.

Creatures within 40 feet of the attractor must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:40|name:Attractor] save if they're within the area when the attractor is activated or as soon as they enter the area while it's active. Once a creature has attempted the save, it uses the same result for the rest of that activation of the attractor.

Any restrictions on a creature's movement apply only if it voluntarily moves away from the attractor. For example, if the attractor moves closer to a creature, the creature doesn't then need to move away.

Chaotic creatures are immune to the effects of the attractor.

The attractor can't be harmed by physical attacks but is destroyed by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.r7ihOgKv19eJQnik]{Disintegrate}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.ihbRf964JDXztcy3]{Disjunction}, a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.HuGZspUvJqR09Y8u]{Rod of Cancellation}, a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.B4DnQNcGl6nFVKHl]{Sphere of Annihilation}, and other similarly powerful effects.

The attractor has an AC of 40 and a counteract DC of 37. A hundun can rebuild a destroyed attractor after [[/br 1d8 #hours]]{1d8 hours} of uninterrupted meditation. If the hundun is slain, its attractor disappears.

Critical Success The creature's movement isn't restricted.

Success The creature treats each square in the area as difficult terrain when moving away from the attractor.

Failure The creature can't move away from the attractor within the area.
U1E1Xka1zLQxC4tT.name: Activate Attractor

zxw1AsQiZy4HbIBa.description: A hundun chaos mage can sense nearby motion through vibration and air movement.
zxw1AsQiZy4HbIBa.name: Motion Sense 100 feet

Hundun Chaos Mage.name: Hundun Chaos Mage
Hundun Chaos Mage.npcAllSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

5rYhqUb2YVDE98ag.description:
Il'setsya infuses her next spell with roiling currents of chaos.

If Il'setsya Casts a Spell before her turn is over and the spell affects a creature, that creature is also subject to a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.rollable-tables.RollTable.yRZwPolTnRdnz42V]{Warpwave}.

If she doesn't Cast a Spell before the beginning of her next turn, this action is wasted.
5rYhqUb2YVDE98ag.name: Warpwave Spell

E3ItzWH7n7tJ4AB0.description:
Il'setya can anticipate the most likely location of a creature through their supernatural insight into the forces of chaotic probabilities and chance. This grants Il'setya the ability to sense creatures within the listed range.

The Il'setya's entropy sense doesn't detect creatures under the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.EoKBlgf6Smt8opaU]{Veil of Privacy} or that are otherwise shielded from divinations and predictions.
E3ItzWH7n7tJ4AB0.name: Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 60 feet

Tillz0YYXHueJmui.description:
Frequency twice per day

Effect Il'setsya steps through a transient hole in space, instantly teleporting to a space within 60 feet that she can see.
Tillz0YYXHueJmui.name: Dimensional Slide

ZaivUgHp2bK6CmBQ.description:
Il'setya's vital organs shift and change shape and position constantly. Immediately after Il'setya takes acid, electricity, or sonic damage, she gains the listed amount of resistance to that damage type. This lasts for 1 hour or until the next time she takes damage of one of the other types (in which case its resistance changes to match that type), whichever comes first.

Il'setya is immune to polymorph effects unless she is a willing target. If @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened}, Il'setya automatically recovers at the end of its next turn as new sensory organs grow to replace the compromised ones.
ZaivUgHp2bK6CmBQ.name: Protean Anatomy 10

yMXbFPudLdFxCrfJ.description: Il'setsya's prehensile tail can hold and manipulate objects of Light Bulk or less, though it cannot be used to attack. She can spend an Interact action to use her tail to fetch objects stowed on her person, such as potions.
yMXbFPudLdFxCrfJ.name: Prehensile Tail

Ink Drowning Vats.description: Steel hatch doors automatically lock shut in each of the four vats labeled J2. Four ink spouts (one per vat) jut through a narrow aperture in the ceiling of each vat, 20 feet above.
Ink Drowning Vats.hazardDisable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:40|name:Seal an Ink Spout|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to seal an ink spout, @Check[type:thievery|dc:48|name:Unlock a Door|traits:action:pick-a-lock] (master) to unlock a steel hatch door, or @Check[type:athletics|dc:45|name:Force Open a Door|traits:action:force-open] (master) to Force Open a steel hatch door
Ink Drowning Vats.hazardReset: The trap can be reset by refilling the ink storage tanks above the vats.
Ink Drowning Vats.hazardRoutine: (4 actions) The trap loses 1 action for each disabled ink spout. On each of the trap's actions, a spout pours ink, increasing the depth of the ink in that vat by 2 feet. Creatures standing in the ink are exposed to a dose of poison ink. Once the vat is full of ink, the trap stops using actions, but creatures in the vat might start drowning.
Ink Drowning Vats.name: Ink Drowning Vats

Inky Tendrils.description: Six giant tentacles reach up from the ink lake, grabbing any foes in reach and dragging them underwater.
Inky Tendrils.hazardDisable:
@Check[type:athletics|dc:48|name:Disable Athletics] (legendary) or @Check[type:athletics|dc:45|name:Disable Acrobatics]{Acrobatics} (master) to tie one tentacle into a knot, rendering it useless, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (8th level; counteract DC 44) to counteract one tentacle.

The death of the Daemonic Rumormonger permanently dispels all the inky tendrils.
Inky Tendrils.hazardRoutine: (6 actions) The hazard loses 1 action for every tentacle that is disabled or destroyed. The tentacles can combine their actions to use the hazard's Inky Imitator ability. A broken tentacle can still Strike, but it can't Grab. This hazard takes no multiple attack penalty.
Inky Tendrils.name: Inky Tendrils

Iron Maiden Trap.description: A pressure plate hidden on the floor before an iron maiden causes the torture device to snap shut and trap the triggering creature inside.
Iron Maiden Trap.hazardDisable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:28|name:Disable Pressure Plate|traits:action:disable-a-device] to disable the pressure plate
Iron Maiden Trap.hazardReset: The pressure plate must be reset manually.
Iron Maiden Trap.name: Iron Maiden Trap

933yJ4bfZhr9zTIX.description:
Trigger The Iroran skeleton is critically hit

Effect The Iroran skeleton collapses into a pile of bones and the attack deals damage for a hit, rather than a critical hit.

The skeleton can reform in a standing position as an action, but until it does, it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}.
933yJ4bfZhr9zTIX.name: Collapse

GutcPWbxQjMoihFA.description: The Iroran skeleton can Stride across liquid surfaces. If it ends its movement on a liquid surface, it falls in as normal.
GutcPWbxQjMoihFA.name: Water Step

ZBfbG1IkIDHWmhM2.description: The Iroran skeleton can Stride along vertical surfaces, such as walls, as long as it begins and ends its movement on a horizontal surface.
ZBfbG1IkIDHWmhM2.name: Wall Run

sVBakTcoJU3kPGlY.description: The Iroran skeleton makes a single Strike and compares the result to the AC of all creatures within its reach, dealing damage to each creature hit.
sVBakTcoJU3kPGlY.name: Whirlwind Kick

shJIHzhh4j6cG3tv.description:
The Iroran skeleton makes two claw Strikes. If both hit the same creature, the damage is combined for the purpose of resistances and weaknesses.

The multiple attack penalty applies to the Strikes as normal.
shJIHzhh4j6cG3tv.name: Flurry of Claws

8j0TGPf1kZlcIwpn.description: Ixusoth reaches out with her mind and attempts to steal memories from a creature within 30 feet. The target must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:40] saving throw or become stupefied 2 and have some of its memories stolen. When Ixusoth steals memories, she learns some of the creature's memories (chosen by the GM). These memories are then lost to that creature.
8j0TGPf1kZlcIwpn.name: Steal Memories

QURekRpCFthbGcMS.description:
A creature hit by Ixusoth's fist Strike must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:36] save. The creature is then temporarily immune until the start of its next turn.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is stunned 1.

Failure The creature is stunned 2.

Critical Failure The creature is stunned 3, and the hyakume can use Steal Memories on the target as part of this action.
QURekRpCFthbGcMS.name: Scatterbrain Palm

ZfiEVipzehZo1cei.description:
This garment appears to be an ordinary robe until donned, at which point numerous strange and alien eyes of varied shapes and colors open and blink across its fabric. While wearing the robe, you gain a +3 item bonus to Perception checks, and you constantly benefit from the effects of a 2nd-level see @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.XXqE1eY3w3z6xJCB]{Invisibility} spell.

You can also see powerful magic auras. The highest-level magic aura within 30 feet of you glows in a color that reveals its school to you and allows you to determine where the effect originates. This can narrow down the origin point of the effect to a 5-foot-cube, but not more precisely than that.

The robe of eyes is not without its dangers. If any spell with the light trait is cast on you or your square while you are wearing the robe, you are blinded for a number of rounds equal to the spell's level unless you succeed at a Fortitude save against the spell's DC.

Activate A Interact

Effect You pluck an eye from the robe and toss it into the air, where it turns invisible and floats to a destination you choose, with the same effect as a 5th-level @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Ek5XI0aEdZhBgm21]{Prying Eye} spell. You can Sustain the Activation just as you would be able to Sustain the Spell.
ZfiEVipzehZo1cei.name: Robe of Eyes

niqal0ySwUPyqG0P.description:
Frequency once per day

Up to six of Ixusoth's eyes detach from her body. Each eye has AC 26, HP 1, and a fly speed of 40 feet. Ixusoth can see through all of her eye probes. She can move the probes all in separate directions using a single action. Ixusoth can have no more than six eye probes active at a time; using this ability to create more eyes causes the eye or eyes farthest away to shrivel and die.

Ixusoth can deliver touch spells through her eye probes and make melee spell attacks through them. In addition, she can Steal Memories through an eye probe using a single action by touching the target with the eye.
niqal0ySwUPyqG0P.name: Eye Probe

rY3uWiPQqOCSmYTu.description: Ixusoth retains a vast amount of knowledge. She can use her Bardic Lore skill to Recall Knowledge on any topic, and she knows any languages common to an area she has spent a day or more in.
rY3uWiPQqOCSmYTu.name: Lore Master

Ixusoth.name: Ixusoth
Ixusoth.npcAllSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. magic

8xAxPvW0rww5NovC.description:
Any creature struck and damaged by an izfiitar's jaws or claw Strike must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:42] save or be subject to a particularly powerful @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.rollable-tables.RollTable.yRZwPolTnRdnz42V]{Warpwave}.

Roll twice and apply both affects, rerolling any duplicates.
8xAxPvW0rww5NovC.name: Greater Warpwave Strike

9m6cGcYmQptppNHf.description:
The izfiitar takes the appearance of any Huge or smaller creature. This doesn't change its Speed or its attack and damage bonuses with its Strikes, but might change the damage type its Strikes deal.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

BsQZslLQ0FJcYne3.description: When the izfiitar casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.HBJPsonQnWcC3qdX]{Hallucinatory Terrain}, it infuses the illusion with quasi-real substance. Creatures that do not disbelieve the illusion treat structures and terrain created through the spell as though they were real, ascending illusory stairs, becoming trapped by illusory quicksand, and so on.
BsQZslLQ0FJcYne3.name: Reshape Reality

JXIun04dusvrOS6n.description:
The izfiitar continuously tinkers with the myriad possibilities in which it can move or manipulate magic.

The izfiitar is always @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} and can use the extra action only to Cast a Spell, Step, or Stride.
JXIun04dusvrOS6n.name: Kiss of the Speakers

UOmYO7g7ej3NwdzH.description:
A izfiitar's vital organs shift and change shape and position constantly. Immediately after the izfiitar takes acid, electricity, or sonic damage, it gains the listed amount of resistance to that damage type. This lasts for 1 hour or until the next time the protean takes damage of one of the other types (in which case its resistance changes to match that type), whichever comes first.

The izfiitar is immune to polymorph effects unless it is a willing target. If @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened}, the izfiitar automatically recovers at the end of its next turn as new sensory organs grow to replace the compromised ones.
UOmYO7g7ej3NwdzH.name: Protean Anatomy 25

XEmgx6gs9UBM9Fqd.description: The izfiitar makes up to six claw Strikes, each against a different target.
XEmgx6gs9UBM9Fqd.name: Storm of Claws

aJI86W6ShmBc7gPN.description:
A Izfiitar can anticipate the most likely location of a creature through their supernatural insight into the forces of chaotic probabilities and chance. This grants the izflitar the ability to sense creatures within the listed range.

The izflitar's entropy sense doesn't detect creatures under the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.EoKBlgf6Smt8opaU]{Veil of Privacy} or that are otherwise shielded from divinations and predictions.
aJI86W6ShmBc7gPN.name: Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 120 feet

o03yd3s67EeP9WOh.description:
Trigger The izfiitar fails a check

Effect The izfiitar rerolls the triggering check and takes the better result.

For [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}, it loses the effects of Kiss of the Speakers and can't use Reshape Reality.
o03yd3s67EeP9WOh.name: Prescient Revision

Izfiitar.name: Izfiitar
Izfiitar.npcAllSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

3XpnxOq9HQF7125Y.description: This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.
3XpnxOq9HQF7125Y.name: Religious Symbol (Norgorber)

7nwDQbdYpJ5U6EZs.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

Flakfatter exudes an aura that makes poisons more potent. His melee Strikes deal an additional @Damage[2d8[persistent,poison]]. Creatures in the aura attempting a flat check to remove persistent poison damage must roll twice and take the lower result. Flakfatter can suppress or resume this aura as a free action.
7nwDQbdYpJ5U6EZs.name: Call Toxins

Ikix1zKqDpYhzRYA.description: Flakfatter targets a creature within 30 feet that's currently subject to a poison affliction. The poison affliction progresses to the next stage.
Ikix1zKqDpYhzRYA.name: Infector

fkyMMwCkFLHVH5BV.description: If a reaction would disrupt Flakfatter's spellcasting action, he attempts a @Check[type:flat|dc:15] check. On a success, the action isn't disrupted.
fkyMMwCkFLHVH5BV.name: Steady Spellcasting

rfWEzJifktPB3Mm1.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.
rfWEzJifktPB3Mm1.name: +1 Spell Storing Dagger (contains crisis of faith)

Jonis Flakfatter.name: Jonis Flakfatter
Jonis Flakfatter.npcAllSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. disease and poison

AD2GrziGoOFfzrk7.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger Kapral is targeted by an attack

Effect Kapral casts blink on herself.
AD2GrziGoOFfzrk7.name: Contingency Plan

YMW42p6dKW5EgBSf.description: This small wooden box contains cosmetics, false facial hair, spirit gum, and a few simple wigs. You usually need a disguise kit to set up a disguise in order to Impersonate someone using the Deception skill. An elite disguise kit adds a +1 item bonus to relevant checks. If you've crafted a large number of disguises, you can replenish your cosmetics supply with replacement cosmetics suitable for the type of your disguise kit.
YMW42p6dKW5EgBSf.name: Disguise Kit (Elite)

xkML6VHwHWx9E7rB.description: This long piece of wood can aid in walking and deliver a mighty blow.
xkML6VHwHWx9E7rB.name: +2 Striking Staff

5hCSuILSsdP2wKtN.description: A ratfolk has stretchy cheek pouches that can store up to 1 cubic foot of objects. The ratfolk can remove or store an item using the Interact action. As long as the ratfolk has at least one object in its cheek pouches, its speech is noticeably difficult to understand.
5hCSuILSsdP2wKtN.name: Cheek Pouches

hrbhUgMW0KZvWovb.description: Kekker has trained extensively with the katar blade. Any katar he wields gains the finesse trait.
hrbhUgMW0KZvWovb.name: Katar Specialist

mjEOGwxDnDNV6VB0.description:
A ratfolk can end its movement in the same square as an ally that also has this ability.

Only two such creatures can share the same space.
mjEOGwxDnDNV6VB0.name: Swarming

viGvtlLGXHhsAVh8.description:
Frequency once per round.

Effect Kekker stores one held item of light or negligible Bulk in his cheek pouches.
viGvtlLGXHhsAVh8.name: Quick Stow

I7zUPwVMtrP17lu5.description:
You can use clever workarounds to replicate the arcane essence of certain materials. When you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.aBQ8ajvEBByv45yz]{Cast a Spell} that requires material components, you can provide these material components without a spell component pouch by drawing intricate replacement sigils in the air.

Unlike when providing somatic components, you still must have a hand completely free. This doesn't remove the need for any materials listed in the spell's cost entry.
I7zUPwVMtrP17lu5.name: Eschew Materials

b7EhfvvU3nImCmog.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.aAbfKn8maGjJjk2W]{Mystic Armor}

You ward yourself with shimmering magical energy, gaining a +1 item bonus to AC and a maximum Dexterity modifier of +5. While wearing mage armor, you use your unarmored proficiency to calculate your AC.
b7EhfvvU3nImCmog.name: Spell Effect: Mage Armor

Kharnas's Lesser Glyph.description: A hidden glyph suddenly lights up and dominates the mind of any creature not bearing the sigil of Kharnas the Angel-Binder.
Kharnas's Lesser Glyph.hazardDisable: Disable @Check[type:thievery|dc:46|name:Destroy Glyph|traits:action:disable-a-device] (legendary) to destroy the glyph, @Check[type:arcana|dc:42|name:Divert Glyph's Power] (master) to harmlessly divert the glyph's power, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (7th level; counteract DC 38) to counteract the glyph
Kharnas's Lesser Glyph.hazardReset: The glyph can affect two creatures before it deactivates for 5 minutes and automatically resets.
Kharnas's Lesser Glyph.name: Kharnas's Lesser Glyph

OCmlinuwWYcoVWLc.description:
Trigger A creature ends its movement adjacent to Kolo

Effect Kolo Steps.
OCmlinuwWYcoVWLc.name: Scurry

b8sV2RLnt3RmLO2t.description: Kolo's melee Strikes deal an extra 1d6 precision damage to Medium or larger creatures.
b8sV2RLnt3RmLO2t.name: Upward Stab

Lie-Master.description:
Glabrezus are looming behemoths who revel in the act of twisting mortal desires into their ultimate ruin, betraying and manipulating as easily as they breathe. Desires granted by a glabrezu always come to fruition in the most destructive way possible, turning a wish or hope into a potent and devastating act of betrayal-although the long-term repercussions are not always immediately apparent. For example, a struggling weapon smith might wish for fame and skill at their craft, only to find that their best patron is a cruel and sadistic murderer who uses the weapons in bloody sprees. Or a lonely widower might have his desire granted in the form of a lost love returned to "life" as a vampire. Glabrezus are nothing if not creative in addressing a mortal's needs.

These massive demons have enormous pincers and a pair of smaller humanoid arms sprouting from their chests, but their size belies their skill at magic, and they possess formidable innate spells. Treachery demons arise from the souls of mortals engaged in treason and deception.

8JslG7YLjptMOVC0.description: A glabrezu can always use Deception when rolling initiative as long as they're aware of at least one opponent before initiative is rolled. When using Deception for initiative, the demon gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Deception.
8JslG7YLjptMOVC0.name: Sudden Betrayal

CWOEh5RnFG5cysRk.description:
Trigger A creature within 15 feet of the lie-master uses a manipulate or move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using

Effect The creature must succeed at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:34] save or be knocked prone by the lie-master's clockwork tentacles.
CWOEh5RnFG5cysRk.name: Tentacle Trip

bmbqZlQmEmeXm2DS.description: A glabrezu's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.i35dpZFI7jZcRoBo]{Illusory Disguise} can allow it to appear as a creature of any size.
bmbqZlQmEmeXm2DS.name: Treacherous Veil

fRDoPX53siUmNijE.description: When a reaction would disrupt a glabrezu's spell, the demon can attempt a @Check[type:flat|dc:17] check, avoiding the disruption on a success.
fRDoPX53siUmNijE.name: Steady Spellcasting

nA5lgWKn3AryAuFs.description: Once per month, a glabrezu can grant a mortal humanoid the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.YfJTXyVGzLhM6V8U]{Miracle} spell granted by an Abyssal patron, though the glabrezu always perverts the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.YfJTXyVGzLhM6V8U]{Miracle} according to their own treacherous nature.
nA5lgWKn3AryAuFs.name: Twisted Desires

pl4CFdDU1X88olbS.description:
Requirements A creature is grabbed in the glabrezu's pincer.

Effect The glabrezu pulls the grabbed creature up to 5 feet closer, then makes two claw Strikes against it. Those Strikes count as one attack when determining a treachery demon's multiple attack penalty, and the penalty doesn't increase until after both Strikes.
pl4CFdDU1X88olbS.name: Captive Rake

r7vHhfdRSulBJtov.description: A glabrezu's lies sustain them, and the truth can destroy them. Whenever a revelation effect counteracts or reveals the glabrezu's illusions or the glabrezu fails a save against an effect that would prevent them from lying (such as zone of truth), the demon takes @Damage[(3d6+4)[mental]] damage. They take this damage only once per effect, even if the effect reveals multiple illusions or prevents multiple lies.
r7vHhfdRSulBJtov.name: Truth Vulnerability

yoqc9IMPx8HSR6k1.description:
Requirements The monster's last action was a success with a Strike that lists Grab in its damage entry, or it has a creature grabbed using this action.

Effect The monster automatically Grabs the target until the end of the monster's next turn. The creature is grabbed by whichever body part the monster attacked with, and that body part can't be used to Strike creatures until the grab is ended. Using Grab extends the duration of the monster's Grab until the end of its next turn for all creatures grabbed by it. A grabbed creature can use the Escape action to get out of the grab, and the Grab ends for a grabbed creatures if the monster moves away from it.
yoqc9IMPx8HSR6k1.name: Grab

Lie-Master.name: Lie-Master
Lie-Master.npcAllSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Life Magnet.description: A magical magnet hidden behind a panel in the corner of the room pulls not metal but living creatures toward it, heedless of any obstacles in the way.
Life Magnet.hazardDisable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:29|name:Deactivate Panel|traits:action:disable-a-device] (expert) to deactivate the panel, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic};(4th level; counteract DC 22) to counteract the panel's magic
Life Magnet.hazardReset: The trap deactivates and resets 1 minute after there are no creatures touching the iron bars.
Life Magnet.hazardRoutine:
(1 action) The trap pulls up to four creatures that have already triggered its Magnetize the Living ability toward one of the far corners of the room, possibly pressing them into the iron bars. If all the iron bars between an affected creature and the magnetic panel remain intact, the creature takes @Damage[(2d10+10)[bludgeoning]] damage with a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:25]{DC 25 basic Fortitude} save and is restrained on a failure (Escape DC 23).

If an iron bar has been broken, the creature takes @Damage[(1d10+5)[bludgeoning]] damage instead, and if two consecutive bars have been broken the creature takes no damage (but might still be restrained on a failed save).
Life Magnet.name: Life Magnet

6BA0nR5VEDa0Aw15.description:
A living mural can move only along flat surfaces such as floors and walls. This allows it to end its movement wrapped around corners when on a continuous surface.

If the surface it's on is destroyed (such as a portrait hit by a fireball spell or a puddle being splashed), the mural takes [[/r {10d6}]]{10d6 damage} and is shunted to the nearest flat surface. If there is no flat surface within 5 feet, the living mural is destroyed.
