6BA0nR5VEDa0Aw15.name: Surface-Bound

6gBFZhqoL9eg2XDz.description:
The subjects depicted within the living mural all reach out at once to attack. The living mural makes a fist Strike against each target within range.

These attacks count toward the living mural's multiple attack penalty, but this penalty doesn't increase until after all of the attacks are made.
6gBFZhqoL9eg2XDz.name: Collective Attack

EKp5irpqgnTwEyjX.description: When a creature attempts to Strike a living mural and critically misses, the attacker hits the surface (a wall, canvas, or so on) behind the living mural. This can damage or break the weapon or surface.
EKp5irpqgnTwEyjX.name: Backdrop

YE6DApvJToive72E.description:
The living mural expels a @Template[type:cone|distance:15] of paint.

Creatures in the area must succeed at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:41] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round.

The living mural can't use Paint the Masses again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Paint the Masses]]{1d4 rounds}.
YE6DApvJToive72E.name: Paint the Masses

snJ95Lkh1TmrNndQ.description: When the living mural hits with a splatter attack, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round.
snJ95Lkh1TmrNndQ.name: Splash of Color

Living Paints.description: A mass of brushes use magical paint to convert creatures into art.
Living Paints.hazardDisable: @Check[type:crafting|dc:41|name:Crafting Disable] (master) to mix the paints into bland, useless colors, @Check[type:thievery|dc:41|name:Thievery Disable] (legendary) to dismantle the animated brushes, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (8th level; counteract DC 41) to counteract the magic within the paint.
Living Paints.name: Living Paints

2RZMlb4O32zwGdui.description:
As you invest these embroidered strips of cloth, you must meditate and slowly wrap them around your hands. These handwraps have weapon runes etched into them to give your unarmed attacks the benefits of those runes, making your unarmed attacks work like magic weapons. For example, +1 striking handwraps of mighty blows would give you a +1 item bonus to attack rolls with your unarmed attacks and increase the damage of your unarmed attacks from one weapon die to two (normally 2d4 instead of 1d4, but if your fists have a different weapon damage die or you have other unarmed attacks, use two of that die size instead).

You can upgrade, add, and transfer runes to and from the handwraps just as you would for a weapon, and you can attach talismans to the handwraps. Treat the handwraps as melee weapons of the brawling group with light Bulk for these purposes. Property runes apply only when they would be applicable to the unarmed attack you're using. For example, a property that must be applied to a slashing weapon wouldn't function when you attacked with a fist, but you would gain its benefits if you attacked with a claw or some other slashing unarmed attack.
2RZMlb4O32zwGdui.name: +3 Greater Striking speed Handwraps of Mighty Blows

BdWPHFjkOXFGTDgi.description:
Trigger A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

Effect The monster attempts a melee Strike against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This Strike doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.
BdWPHFjkOXFGTDgi.name: Attack of Opportunity

CCz3eaJWNZAPwqBS.description: Whenever Lord Guirden makes a fist Strike and hits, he can choose to apply either the Grab, Knockdown, or Push ability to his attack.
CCz3eaJWNZAPwqBS.name: Master Brawler

JJluFLD9A2iKiNi4.description: Lord Guirden makes two fist Strikes, ignoring the multiple attack penalty until after both Strikes.
JJluFLD9A2iKiNi4.name: Double Punch

qOiRJ4goVAPViPIt.description:
Requirements Lord Guirden has a Medium or smaller creature grabbed

Effect Lord Guirden hurls the grabbed creature into a target adjacent to him. He makes a fist Strike against the adjacent target. On a success, the target and hurled creature both take 3d10+14 bludgeoning damage and are knocked prone. On a failure, only the thrown creature takes the damage and is knocked prone.
qOiRJ4goVAPViPIt.name: Hurl

Lusca.description: A lusca is a predatory sea monster that resembles a three-headed shark with the body of an octopus. Ferocious electrical storms usually herald a lusca's arrival; such violent bursts of electricity result from the creature's superconductive flesh, which allows the lusca to store energy from lightning strikes that it can then discharge at foes.

DSVJsEHiWFPACcNX.description:
The lusca gains 2 extra reactions at the start of each of its turns that it can use only to make an Attack of Opportunity with its jaws. It can't use more than one Attack of Opportunity triggered by the same action.

Trigger A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

Effect The monster attempts a melee Strike against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This Strike doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.
DSVJsEHiWFPACcNX.name: Attack of Opportunity

RkUX9VYzuGsIycUb.description: The lusca can smell blood in the water up to 1 mile away.
RkUX9VYzuGsIycUb.name: Blood Scent

VzGeaeMNgzVgxvGo.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:38]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 4d6 poison damage and clumsy 1 (1 round)

Stage 2 6d6 poison damage and clumsy 2 (1 round)
VzGeaeMNgzVgxvGo.name: Lusca Venom

f9SGRyWKHiuofcI9.description: The lusca makes three jaws Strikes, each against a different target. These attacks count toward the lusca's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after the lusca makes all of these attacks. If the lusca subsequently uses the Grab action, it Grabs any number of creatures it hit with Ravenous Jaws.
f9SGRyWKHiuofcI9.name: Ravenous Jaws

hDbNl3kiEPn8AUos.description: The lusca tries to capsize an adjacent aquatic vessel of its size or smaller. It must succeed at an Athletics check with a DC of 35 (reduced by 5 for each size smaller the vessel is than the lusca) or the pilot's Sailing Lore DC, whichever is higher.
hDbNl3kiEPn8AUos.name: Capsize

uW2CbK6jDKtg1sG4.description: When the lusca is near the surface for more than 1 hour, clouds appear and deliver a thunderstorm with a 2-mile radius centered on its location. The weather returns to normal 1 hour after the lusca departs.
uW2CbK6jDKtg1sG4.name: Storm Bringer

Lusca.name: Lusca

7vOzE1FHZEotvswQ.name: +2 Status Bonus on Saves vs. Shove

DLJfYIHzmCQGAW0s.description:
Trigger Maurrisa can make an Attack of Opportunity

Effect Maurrisa chops her opponent on the back of the head or neck, possibly concussing them.

The target must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:26] save. On a failure, the creature takes damage as if hit by Maurrisa's fist Strike, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}. On a critical failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3} instead.
DLJfYIHzmCQGAW0s.name: Rabbit Punch

FvZvIio9Hz2dvltI.description:
Trigger A creature misses two consecutive melee Strikes against Maurrisa

Effect Maurrisa takes advantage of a flailing foe's opening. She can either Step 5 feet or make a melee Strike against the triggering creature.
FvZvIio9Hz2dvltI.name: Duck and Weave

hhg7o2qV6JntAswy.name: +2 Status Bonus on Saves vs. Trip

yzzm5eV3r1RGpar6.name: +1 Status Bonus on Saves vs. Incapacitation Effects

Maurrisa Jonne.name: Maurrisa Jonne
Maurrisa Jonne.npcAllSaves: +1 status bonus to saves vs. incapacitation effects, +2 status bonus to saves vs. Shove and Trip

SczLJpfQwYYTKEvD.description: The minchgorm raises up to eight figures from nearby water, each appearing in an empty space within 60 feet of the minchgorm. A simulacrum can take any shape of size Medium or smaller that the minchgorm desires, including that of a specific individual or object, but is always plainly made of water. The minchgorm can speak, cast spells, and use its senses through its simulacra, spending actions for a simulacrum on a one-for-one basis. By using a single action with the concentrate trait, the minchgorm can cause any number of simulacra to Fly, Step, Stride, or Swim up to 60 feet. A simulacrum uses the minchgorm's AC and saving throws and has 30 Hit Points. A minchgorm can have up to eight simulacra in existence at once. Simulacra dissolve immediately when more than 60 feet from the minchgorm, or if the minchgorm dies or falls unconscious. The minchgorm can dismiss any number of its simulacra as a free action.
SczLJpfQwYYTKEvD.name: Watery Simulacra

WWLbZOyOAUEoJrVO.description:
Trigger The minchgorm Grabs a creature in its jaws

Effect The minchgorm uses Swallow Whole.
WWLbZOyOAUEoJrVO.name: Fast Swallow

kVdw249CmzAbj17U.description: Tentacles of water rise up and attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} all enemies within 15 feet of the minchgorm. The minchgorm attempts an @Check[type:athletics] check against the Fortitude DC of each creature in the area. On a success, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} (Escape DC 40). On a critical success, or a success against a creature that is already grabbed, the target begins to drown.
kVdw249CmzAbj17U.name: Riptide

5qAf1qV6aq6q3pQl.description: Each time a creature willingly performs a service, quest, or task for the zealborn, the creature takes a cumulative -1 status penalty to saving throws against the zealborn's mental spells and abilities (maximum -4).
5qAf1qV6aq6q3pQl.name: Little Favors

7kep2BZKcI8m29QV.description: When Miogimo is destroyed, he re-forms, fully healed, near a follower of his choice in [[/br 1d10 #Rejuvenation]]{1d10 days}. For the purposes of rejuvenation, a follower is defined as an intelligent creature who's well acquainted with Miogimo and is a true believer in Miogimo's mission, not merely a lukewarm supporter. Miogimo can be permanently destroyed only if he has no current followers or can be convinced to end his own life.
7kep2BZKcI8m29QV.name: Rejuvenation

CcCVlFjqLYk2DTlc.name: +1 Status to Will Saves vs. Mental

ZoDu12928nPzUoAD.description: Miogimo can't regain Hit Points through resting or negative healing; he feeds only on the idealism of his supporters, regaining 10 Hit Points per day for each creature under the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Q690d3mw3TUrKX7E]{Geas} cast by Miogimo. Creatures under Miogimo's geas have their maximum HP reduced by 10 each day until they are burned away to a husk and perish. After 24 hours, such creatures rise as zeal-damned ghouls under Miogimo's control. Zeal-damned ghouls eat only the flesh of evil or chaotic creatures and deal an additional 1d6 chaotic and 1d6 negative damage with their attacks.
ZoDu12928nPzUoAD.name: Zealous Restoration

mNgkZuWHNH6FJsSb.description:
Trigger An effect would cause Miogimo to become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} or would slow his movement

Effect Miogimo casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.aqRYNoSvxsVfqglH]{Freedom of Movement} on himself.
mNgkZuWHNH6FJsSb.name: Trickster's Ace

Miogimo.name: Miogimo
Miogimo.npcAllSaves: +1 status bonus to Will saves vs. mental effects

2w1WQr635JVnsORb.description: Mobana can move her full speed when @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneaking}.
2w1WQr635JVnsORb.name: Swift Sneak

CWcYZHN9MSfxTR2k.description: Mobana deals an extra 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

XQXyh2fMab1x1Hjh.description:
Giant centipede venom causes severe muscle stiffness.

Activate D Interact (Injury)

Saving Throw DC 17 Fortitude

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d8[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[1d12[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}, and off-guard (1 round)

cYpzRpaINHeW2XxC.description:
Requirements Mobana is wielding a piercing or slashing weapon and has a free hand.

Effect Mobana applies a poison to the weapon.
cYpzRpaINHeW2XxC.name: Poison Weapon

ePXkUAkuSGauQ7Jv.description: Mobana has spent years in close proximity to the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.k9BYXA4b7Z4Hy6lZ]{Deafening Music Box} in her possession and is immune to its effects. She also gains a +2 circumstance bonus against sonic effects and effects that impose the deafened condition
ePXkUAkuSGauQ7Jv.name: Supersonic Hearing

kzNiR7bLBxL4aWfR.description: Mobana Interacts to draw a weapon, then Strikes with that weapon.
kzNiR7bLBxL4aWfR.name: Quick Draw

t5skSqnTS4aKuuan.description: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted yet are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the assassin.
t5skSqnTS4aKuuan.name: Surprise Attack

xhZKk4oQRgs08i0T.description:
Trigger Mobana is targeted with a melee or ranged attack by an attacker they can see.

Effect Mobana gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.
xhZKk4oQRgs08i0T.name: Nimble Dodge

xxxZ0reFCEDypJhH.description:
Symbols of musical notes decorate this gold-framed wooden cube measuring just under 1 foot by 1 foot. A funnel-shaped trumpet protrudes from the box's top at an angle, though it feels surprisingly light. The box has a large button on its side, and it must be set down on a flat surface in order to activate it; while it's activated, the rumbling and churning gears inside the box make it impossible to carry without dropping it.

ActivateAInteract;Effect You press the button on the side of the music box, causing it to erupt with a cacophonous and discordant melody for 1 minute while it plays its entire melody, and it can't be shut off prematurely. The music is so loud that any creature within 60 feet must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:24] or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} for as long as they remain within 60 feet of the music box, and for 1 minute thereafter. On a critical success, a creature need not make any more saves and is temporarily immune to thedeafening music boxfor the next 24 hours; on a success, the creature must attempt a new save each round it remains within 60 feet of the music box.

zeH3OrBLioIRoYb5.description: Mobana isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to creatures of 8th level or lower that are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected}, flanking or using @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.w6rMqmGzhUahdnA7]{Surprise Attack}.
zeH3OrBLioIRoYb5.name: Deny Advantage

FY9YGIGBEeh0FNKi.description:
DC 38

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[3d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[4d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3} (1 round).
FY9YGIGBEeh0FNKi.name: Mother Venom Poison

KFdVbNhK30Xo6GCp.description: Mother Venom can command her minions and the oozes that cover her dungeon to attack foes. As long as she's conscious, she can make melee ooze tendril Strikes that originate from any slime-covered terrain in her dungeon, including the dungeon's walls and doors, or from a space occupied by one of her children of venom.
KFdVbNhK30Xo6GCp.name: Ooze Tendril

lVTqn24kqmGrjWJI.description: A creature hit by Mother Venom's spit attack is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} and stuck to the nearest surface (Escape DC 38).
lVTqn24kqmGrjWJI.name: Spit

Mr. Snips.description: Traditionally crafted into the forms of giant suits of armor or powerful animals, iron golems are products of exquisite artistry and skill. Their articulated joints and sturdy armored bodies require great care and mathematical precision to craft, and regular cleaning and oiling ensure they don't rust over the ages. With proper care, iron golems can remain in good shape for thousands of years, being passed down for generations, as long as they aren't destroyed by meddlesome adventurers. In addition to their incredible strength, iron golems possess a potent toxic breath weapon that is often more than enough to dispatch entire groups of opponents.

HkUjt1e6CiwdfHoy.description: The iron golem exhales poisonous gas in a 10-foot radius centered on the corner of one of the iron golem's squares. The gas persists for 1 round. Any creature in the area (or that later enters the area) is exposed to the iron golem's poison. The golem can't use its Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.
HkUjt1e6CiwdfHoy.name: Breath Weapon

RSzJjCjwpz8jIS3J.description:
Any @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained} value from this poison is reduced by 1 every hour.

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:33]

Maximum Duration 4 rounds

Stage 1 2d6 poison and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 4d6 poison and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 8d6 poison and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 3} (1 round).
RSzJjCjwpz8jIS3J.name: Iron Golem Poison

SJraLZmz7x1C04ki.description: Magical rusting effects, like a rust monster's antennae, affect the iron golem normally.
SJraLZmz7x1C04ki.name: Vulnerable to Rust

aMNM0X0dVvVRdlZT.description: Casting @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.SUKaxVZW2TlM8lu0]{Neutralize Poison} on the golem deactivates its Breath Weapon for 1 minute.
aMNM0X0dVvVRdlZT.name: Vulnerable to Neutralize Poison

lYvWF5v5Vah9KWsN.description:
harmed by acid (6d10, 2d8 from areas and persistent damage); healed by fire (area 2d8 HP); slowed by electricity

A golem is immune to spells and magical abilities other than its own, but each type of golem is affected by a few types of magic in special ways. These exceptions are listed in shortened form in the golem's stat block, with the full rules appearing here. If an entry lists multiple types (such as "cold and water"), either type of spell can affect the golem. Harmed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem causes it to take the listed amount of damage (this damage has no type) instead of the usual effect. If the golem starts its turn in an area of magic of this type or is affected by a persistent effect of the appropriate type, it takes the damage listed in the parenthetical. Healed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem makes the golem lose the slowed condition and gain HP equal to half the damage the spell would have dealt. If the golem starts its turn in an area of this type of magic, it gains the HP listed in the parenthetical. Slowed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem causes it to be slowed 1 for [[/br 2d6 #rounds]]{2d6 rounds} instead of the usual effect. If the golem starts its turn in an area of this type of magic, it's slowed 1 for that round. Vulnerable To Each golem is vulnerable to one or more specific spells, with the effects described in its stat block.
lYvWF5v5Vah9KWsN.name: Golem Antimagic

nhz5F428cTKGkc9v.description: The iron golem Strides up to its Speed, pushing back each creature whose space it moves into and damaging them if they try to stop its movement. A creature can attempt to bar the way by succeeding at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:37] save. On a critical success, the resisting creature takes no damage; otherwise, it is damaged as if hit by the golem's fist.
nhz5F428cTKGkc9v.name: Inexorable March

yhVKDXeyQEVchPJW.description:
Whenever Mr. Snips rolls a critical hit with a scissors Strike, in addition to dealing extra damage, the golem has a chance to dismember its victim. The target must roll a @Check[type:reflex|dc:39|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Success No additional effect

Failure The target takes @Damage[2d10[bleed]].

Critical Failure As failure, and one of the targets extremities is severed (the effects of this are up to the GM's discretion).
yhVKDXeyQEVchPJW.name: Dismember

Mr. Snips.name: Mr. Snips

ITQk9n2tp7J5FDQa.description:
The night hag can take on the appearance of any Medium female humanoid. This doesn't change her Speed or her attack and damage bonuses with her Strikes, but might change the damage type her Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]
ITQk9n2tp7J5FDQa.name: Change Shape

PlFu6E3ZCVF3JCam.description: When a night hag rides a nightmare, the nightmare also gains the night hag's status bonus to saves against magic, and both the hag and rider benefit when the night hag uses her heartstone's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.D2nPKbIS67m9199U]{Ethereal Jaunt} innate spell.
PlFu6E3ZCVF3JCam.name: Nightmare Rider

RE6Tnx8I1IisyMoz.description:
This gemstone grants its wearer a +2 item bonus to saving throws.

Each heartstone is powered by the spirit of a specific night hag. If it's separated from her for 24 hours (or she's been dead for 24 hours), it becomes a nonmagical gemstone. A heartstone allows the hag to use additional occult innate spells: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.D2nPKbIS67m9199U]{Ethereal Jaunt} (9th level) and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.GYmXvS9NJ7QwfWGg]{Bind Soul} at will, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.IqJ9URobmJ9L9UBG]{Shadow Blast} twice per day.

Activate A command

Requirements You must be touching the heartstone.

Effect The heartstone attempts to counteract one disease affecting you (counteract level 5, counteract modifier +18).

Craft Requirements You must be a night hag.
RE6Tnx8I1IisyMoz.name: Heartstone

UPbjq29xf3jaLian.description:
Sewn from several long strips of luxurious brown and black silk, this cloak grants you a +3 item bonus to Stealth checks as well as to Acrobatics checks to Maneuver in Flight. You can also use your feet to hang from any surface that can support your weight, without requiring any check, though you still must attempt Athletics checks to Climb in order to move around while inverted.

Activate D command, Interact

Frequency any number of times per day

Effect You can either transform the cloak into bat-like wings that grant you a fly Speed of 30 feet for 10 minutes, or have the cloak turn you into a bat by casting a 4th-level @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gfPjmG6Fe6D3MFjl]{Pest Form} spell on you.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.ioGzmVSmMGXWWBYb]{Effect: Cloak of the Bat}
UPbjq29xf3jaLian.name: Cloak of the Bat (Greater)

qLsi1de5hGC6uHjL.description: A creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the night hag takes a -2 circumstance penalty to checks and DCs to defend against her spells.
qLsi1de5hGC6uHjL.name: Spell Ambush

rpruEIwmxeOzTZOp.description: If a night hag is ethereal and hovering over a sleeping chaotic or evil creature, she can ride the victim's back until dawn. The creature endures tormenting dreams as the hag casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Uqj344bezBq3ESdq]{Nightmare} on it, and is exposed to abyssal plague. Any drained caused by dream haunting is cumulative. Only an ethereal being can confront the night hag and stop her dream haunting.
rpruEIwmxeOzTZOp.name: Dream Haunting

uOIdVHoijKlxOrxM.description:
A creature can't recover from drained until Abyssal plague is cured

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:41]

Stage 1 drained 1 (1 day)

Stage 2 drained 3 (1 day)
uOIdVHoijKlxOrxM.name: Abyssal Plague

utBhBKO5t1Pl4TVo.description: As long as at least one other member of Myrna's coven is on the demiplane of Stormholt, the coven members add chain lightning, lightning bolt, plane shift, and punishing winds to their spells, each of which can be cast at up to 8th level.
utBhBKO5t1Pl4TVo.name: Planar Coven

2JN5a5P81ZqQkOsD.description: When attempting a save against a light effect, a myrucarx gets a result one degree of success lower than it rolled. A myrucarx caught in sunlight is stunned 2 and clumsy 2.
2JN5a5P81ZqQkOsD.name: Painful Light

87HtA52J9Oqfjsft.description: The illusion created by the myrucarx's project image can resemble any Medium humanoid, including any specific individual it has seen, and has appropriate voice, scent, and mannerisms, allowing the myrucarx to use its Deception check to Impersonate that humanoid if it chooses.
87HtA52J9Oqfjsft.name: Illusory Persona

e5D3G73TDu6XWskj.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The fanged mouths at the ends of a myrucarx's tendrils twist around obstacles. The myrucarx makes two jaws Strikes against the same target, ignoring the target's cover. Both attacks count toward the myrucarx's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after both attacks are made. The myrucarx can't Grab as its next action after Twisting Reach.
e5D3G73TDu6XWskj.name: Twisting Reach

hJJc012AkwlepsfP.description: A myrucarx emits no smell and can't be detected by scent.
hJJc012AkwlepsfP.name: Odorless

126ppmFKAd49r2hi.description: The najra lizard's melee Strikes deal 1d6 precision damage to creatures sharing a square with more than one najra lizard.
126ppmFKAd49r2hi.name: Najra Swarm Attack

Q10SWwitCSafoJ4L.description:
Trigger Another creature in the najra lizard's square succeeds at a Deception check to Create a Diversion

Effect The najra lizard automatically successfully @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.GkmbTGfg8KcgynOA]{Creates a Diversion} against the same targets.
Q10SWwitCSafoJ4L.name: Shared Diversion

yut11i3oSOwRk5mZ.description:
The creature is extremely thirsty and can't quench its thirst while poisoned

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:21|traits:poison]

Maximum Duration 4 hours

Stage 1 @Damage[1d4[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}, and [[/r {1d4}]]{1d4 damage} that can't be recovered until the creature quenches its thirst (1 round)

Stage 2 as stage 1 (1 hour)
yut11i3oSOwRk5mZ.name: Najra Lizard Venom

Needling Stairs.description: This staircase has springs in each step, which send poisoned needles shooting up through tiny holes in the wood when stepped on. Each step, 6 in total, takes up one 5-foot square.
Needling Stairs.hazardDisable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:33|name:Disable Stair Spring|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) on each stair to disable its spring, or deactivate the switch in area C8 to deactivate the whole trap. Cutting the wire on the topmost stair (>@Check[type:thievery|dc:35|name:Cut Wire on Top-Most Stair|traits:action:disable-a-device] to Disable the Device) that connects the staircase to the control switch prevents the control switch from turning the trap on or off.
Needling Stairs.hazardReset: If deactivated via the switch, the trap can be reactivated with the switch in area C8.
Needling Stairs.hazardRoutine: (1 action) The trap makes a separate poisoned needle Strike against each creature currently on an active step as 1 action. Because it is constantly jabbing needles up through any weight-bearing steps, the trap can also use its Bloody Feet free action to jab at a creature on one of the steps during that creature's turn.
Needling Stairs.name: Needling Stairs

2wSPUQgCOkfTQCUJ.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Hq1vagZwNS6eDSNA.description:
A creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} by the sahkil's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.O6VQC1Bs4aSYDa6R]{Mask of Terror} is gripped with fear of the ways magic can go wrong.

The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for as long as it is frightened. If the creature Casts a Spell during its turn, it can't reduce its frightened condition at the end of that turn.
Hq1vagZwNS6eDSNA.name: Tainted Backlash

LBQk96wXoxYrTUZi.description:
Trigger A creature targets the nenchuuj with a spell

Effect The nenchuuj warps the creature's magic, attempting an Arcana check to counteract the spell. If successful, the nenchuuj can instead redirect the spell, as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.OOELvfkTedBMlWtq]{Spell Turning}, onto the caster or onto a different target within range from the caster.
LBQk96wXoxYrTUZi.name: Distort Magic

LvYtP53GFOEynRGV.description: The sahkil can move itself between the Ethereal Plane and the Material Plane, as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.D2nPKbIS67m9199U]{Ethereal Jaunt}, except that this ability has an unlimited duration and can be Dismissed.
LvYtP53GFOEynRGV.name: Skip Between

bZAhdsbYFuZ2syFl.description: The sahkil is considered 2 levels lower for the purposes of being summoned by rituals (such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.2ykmAVKrsAWcazcC]{Planar Binding}), but is always free to attack or leave instead of negotiate unless the primary caster's check is a critical success.
bZAhdsbYFuZ2syFl.name: Easy to Call

Nenchuuj.name: Nenchuuj
Nenchuuj.npcAllSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. magic

HLLn9CHqmRrWk4IN.description:
Trigger The poisoner is targeted with a melee or ranged attack by an attacker it can see

Effect The poisoner gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.
HLLn9CHqmRrWk4IN.name: Nimble Dodge

PTHHSvW8TM9Qoy4r.description: These blades come in a variety of shapes and styles, but they are typically 2 feet long.
PTHHSvW8TM9Qoy4r.name: +1 Striking Shortsword

TAic4n8t4egJtNJX.description: The poisoner isn't off-guard to creatures of 11th level or lower that are hidden, undetected, flanking, or using surprise attack.
TAic4n8t4egJtNJX.name: Deny Advantage

ZX0T6lbLJyKn8KuN.description: Creatures the poisoner hits with a critical hit are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against their attacks until the end of their next turn.
ZX0T6lbLJyKn8KuN.name: Unbalancing Blow

pWF0uGOYSVrS0HHX.description: The poisoner deals an additional 3d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

sqgbfXYmkJqyZ1xu.description:
This long, hollow proboscis is harvested from the notorious bloodseeker beast and drips a trickle of blood.

Activate F Envision

Trigger You hit an off-guard creature with the affixed weapon

When you activate the beak, you deal an extra 1d4 precision damage on your damage roll. If you deal sneak attack damage to the creature, you also deal @Damage[1d4[bleed]].
sqgbfXYmkJqyZ1xu.name: Bloodseeker Beak

va3CnUqjuHNbajzr.description:
Cost 1 batch of infused reagents

Effect The poisoner dribbles a few experimental chemicals over a melee weapon. Until the start of their next turn, Strikes with the weapon deal an additional @Damage[2d8[poison]] damage, and targets hit by Strikes with the weapon must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:27|traits:damaging-effect] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (the poisoner's choice) for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.
va3CnUqjuHNbajzr.name: Impromptu Toxin

DNVNuZGCllMw1hmA.description: When a creature is grabbed by the obrousian, its lungs magically fill with water. A creature that can't breathe water is suffocating while it is grabbed.
DNVNuZGCllMw1hmA.name: Drowning Grasp

ciQ62q9OynsChQSL.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

When a creature ends its turn in the aura, it is overwhelmed by the sorrow that suffuses the obrousian's being. The creature must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:33] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round.
ciQ62q9OynsChQSL.name: Waves of Sorrow

zX6RvKVyn16ug6vJ.description: The obrousian can take on the appearance of any Small or Medium humanoid. This increases their Speed to 25 feet. It doesn't change their attack and damage modifiers with their Strikes, but it might change the damage type their Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).
zX6RvKVyn16ug6vJ.name: Change Shape

4T0hd15HFgEoLTEv.description: The ofalth zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.
4T0hd15HFgEoLTEv.name: Slow

9dxZ2UN0t2f32r0f.description:
The ofalth zombie makes a fling offal Strike and compares the attack roll result to the AC of any foes within the area of a @Template[type:cone|distance:15] emanating from the ofalth zombie. This counts as two attacks for the ofalth zombie's multiple attack penalty.

The ofalth zombie can't use Bury in Offal again until it moves at least 10 feet to a different space.
9dxZ2UN0t2f32r0f.name: Bury in Offal

Tbf45tR5JDVDyJCc.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:10]{10 feet} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

The zombie emits an aura of rot and disease that causes wounds to fester and turn sour. Any living creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the Ofalth Zombie and is not at full Hit Points takes [[/r 1d6]] damage as its wounds fester.

Creatures that take a critical hit from the Ofalth Zombie also take this damage immediately.

Note: This ability lists a DC 24 in the source, but the glossary ability lacks a save to make.
Tbf45tR5JDVDyJCc.name: Rotting Aura

lmVllcsiFHe8ybRy.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:22]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d8[bleed]] every hour and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d8[bleed]] every hour and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 day)
lmVllcsiFHe8ybRy.name: Wretched Weeps

pxtdz9Cb1KUHXsrM.description: The ofalth zombie gains fast healing 2 as long as it is in the Catacombs or another area with a high concentration of dead.
pxtdz9Cb1KUHXsrM.name: Corpse Wallow

0k8i82stB4T6FXRO.name: Teleport (At Will) (Self Only) (Only within Terimor's Tower)

2yp2PpkHqWXuA5k0.description:
Olansa's true form is that of a monstrous spiderlike daemon. Olansa can still take on her former human appearance. This doesn't change her Speed or her attack and damage modifiers with her Strikes.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

O6wQ2EWNzgJGn6Ta.description:
Frequency once per hour

Trigger Olansa successfully uses Stealth to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} and become hidden from all of her current foes, or she uses Stealth to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} and become undetected to all her current foes

Effect Olansa becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} for 1 minute, even if she uses a hostile action. Not even @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.0qaqksrGGDj74HXE]{Glitterdust}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.jwK43yKsHTkJQvQ9]{See the Unseen}, or similar effects can reveal her, though creatures can still use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} action to locate her.
O6wQ2EWNzgJGn6Ta.name: Hidden Paragon

RPGIrySxh4Qa0yaP.description: Olansa deals 4d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

hbg1FrfQIQ6EAWuz.description:
Trigger A creature within Olansa's melee reach is hit by a melee attack from one of her allies

Effect Olansa Strikes the triggering creature.
hbg1FrfQIQ6EAWuz.name: Opportune Backstab

Gy4RoLuOaQU79ESu.description: An imentesh's Strikes deal an additional 4d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} targets.

I23rYMszuvKL97k7.description:
A overdrive imentesh's vital organs shift and change shape and position constantly.

Immediately after the hegessik takes acid, electricity, or sonic damage, it gains the listed amount of resistance to that damage type. This lasts for 1 hour or until the next time the protean takes damage of one of the other types (in which case its resistance changes to match that type), whichever comes first.

The overdrive imentesh is immune to polymorph effects unless it is a willing target. If @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened}, the overdrive imentesh automatically recovers at the end of its next turn as new sensory organs grow to replace the compromised ones.
I23rYMszuvKL97k7.name: Protean Anatomy

O97E3bY0dRr5pLCH.description: An imentesh inflicts a @RollTable[cBHMpmeIhoBdUyQT]{Warpwave} on a creature within 100 feet (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:38] to resist).
O97E3bY0dRr5pLCH.name: Inflict Warpwave

TmEWLqRkXgHmnIV4.description:
The imentesh takes the appearance of any Large or smaller creature. This doesn't change its Speed or its attack and damage bonuses with its Strikes, but it might change the damage type its Strikes deal.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

lZznKQkFobPXBxDT.description: Any creature struck and damaged by an imentesh's jaws Strike must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:38] save or be subject to a @RollTable[cBHMpmeIhoBdUyQT]{Warpwave}.
lZznKQkFobPXBxDT.name: Warpwave Strike

zn2a2GvxqbknqXbo.description:
An overdrive imentesh can anticipate the most likely location of a creature through their supernatural insight into the forces of chaotic probabilities and chance. This grants the overdrive imentesh the ability to sense creatures within the listed range.

The overdrive imentesh's entropy sense doesn't detect creatures under the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.EoKBlgf6Smt8opaU]{Veil of Privacy} or that are otherwise shielded from divinations and predictions.
zn2a2GvxqbknqXbo.name: Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 60 feet

Overdrive Imentesh.name: Overdrive Imentesh
Overdrive Imentesh.npcAllSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Pelmo.description:
The frontline fighters of goblin tribes prefer to fight in large groups-especially when they can outnumber their foes at least three to one.

These small humanoids have green or gray skin and large heads with wide ears. While some goblins are civilized and have worked hard to be considered upstanding members of humanoid communities, most are impetuous and vicious creatures who delight in wreaking havoc. These goblins think nothing of slaughtering livestock, stealing infants, or burning down a building purely for momentary delight. They revel in playing malicious tricks on taller humanoids, whom they call "longshanks."

Goblins are superstitious, with an intense awe of magic and a fascination with fire; goblins who master magic or fire earn great respect from their kin. Most other humanoids find it difficult to understand goblins' outlook: they hate canines but eagerly share their lairs with so-called "goblin dogs," they fearlessly attack larger creatures but are terrified of horses, and they despise vegetables yet consider pickles a delicacy. To a goblin, of course, these are all perfectly sensible life choices.

32FbUxGNpWinXjEq.description:
Trigger A goblin ally ends a move action adjacent to Pelmo.

Effect Pelmo @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.UHpkTuCtyaPqiCAB]{Steps}.
32FbUxGNpWinXjEq.name: Goblin Scuttle

Pelmo.name: Pelmo

29naBTIemmuYyMKB.description: The sahkil can move itself between the Ethereal Plane and the Material Plane, as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.D2nPKbIS67m9199U]{Ethereal Jaunt}, except that this ability has an unlimited duration and can be Dismissed
29naBTIemmuYyMKB.name: Skip Between

DNsLOiJgbt3epj8c.description: The penqual Strides twice, ignoring difficult terrain, and then uses Frantic Grasp. If it moves at least 20 feet away from its starting position, the DC of Frantic Grasp increases by 2.
DNsLOiJgbt3epj8c.name: Mob Rush

EEMf91Mnk5n3dYup.description: Each enemy in the penqual's space takes @Damage[4d12[slashing]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:36|basic:true] save).
EEMf91Mnk5n3dYup.name: Frantic Grasp

KkQu3TqvmvRwh5Gx.description:
A creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} by the sahkil's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.O6VQC1Bs4aSYDa6R]{Mask of Terror} feels the press of a suffocating crowd.

The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and takes a -10-foot penalty to all Speeds for as long as it is frightened.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.R8clbf7gtIlU3fIj]{Effect: Crush of Hundreds}
KkQu3TqvmvRwh5Gx.name: Crush of Hundreds

TxhGff0LtzQslOci.description: The sahkil is considered 2 levels lower for the purposes of being summoned by rituals (such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.2ykmAVKrsAWcazcC]{Planar Binding}), but is always free to attack or leave instead of negotiate unless the primary caster's check is a critical success.
TxhGff0LtzQslOci.name: Easy to Call

XC6rH5AiexqlIUrJ.description: The penqual is a swarm of Medium figures that can squeeze supernaturally close to other creatures. Though its component creatures are larger than those of a typical swarm, a penqual can nevertheless share the spaces of other creatures.
XC6rH5AiexqlIUrJ.name: Crowded Mob

v8mqftrhdYYjlA4r.name: Mask of Terror (See Crush of Hundreds)

Penqual.name: Penqual
Penqual.npcAllSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

5DSmWdkGY2DeiYD8.description:
When a pickled punk hits a target larger than itself, it uses bizarre excretions to adhere to that creature. This is similar to Grabbing the creature, but the pickled punk is not off-guard, and it moves with that creature rather than holding it in place.

Each turn while attached, the pickled punk automatically deals the damage from its jaws Strike to the creature to which it's attached. It also wriggles about, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC as long as it's not also grabbed or restrained.
5DSmWdkGY2DeiYD8.name: Attach

C8jd840fpmYd3wDB.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:5]{5 feet} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

A creature that enters or begins its turn within the aura must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:14] save, or @Check[type:fortitude|dc:17] if the pickled punk is attached to the creature.

On a failed save, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}, and on a critical failure, it's also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 minute.
C8jd840fpmYd3wDB.name: Suffocating Fumes

sZjoXHynGmaJPLpi.description: The first time each round that a pickled punk takes fire damage, its fumes combust, dealing @Damage[5[fire]] damage to all other creatures within the area of its Suffocating Fumes aura.
sZjoXHynGmaJPLpi.name: Combustible

Plunger Chute.description: A trapdoor in the floor conceals a hidden chute, and a moving section of wall shoves victims into it.
Plunger Chute.hazardDisable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:23|name:Jam the Trapdoor Shut|traits:action:disable-a-device] (expert) to jam the trapdoor shut or activate a hidden bypass switch by twisting a fitting on the gas lamp
Plunger Chute.name: Plunger Chute

C8jCG9WTW2fP6H0b.description:
Requirements The poison eater isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} or already in a frenzy

Trigger the poison eater damages a creature while Consume Poison is in effect

Effect The poison eater flies into a frenzy that lasts for 1 minute. While in a frenzy, the poison eater gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls with melee Strikes, gains a +4 status bonus to damage rolls with melee Strikes, gains 20 temporary Hit Points until the end of the frenzy, and takes a -2 status penalty to AC. The poison eater can't voluntarily end their frenzy. After their frenzy, the poison eater is fatigued.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.u2z1BgpZsxl7Zc2z]{Effect: Poison Frenzy}
C8jCG9WTW2fP6H0b.name: Poison Frenzy

RiF9Uw43dbvL8TEa.description:
The poison eater uses an Interact action to draw a dose of poison and eats it, gaining strength.

The poison-eater's Strikes deal two weapon dice of damage rather than one. The poison eater is affected by the consumed poison normally and, therefore, usually chooses poisons mitigated by their poison resistance and toxin-inured ability.

At the end of each of their turns, the poison eater attempts a @Check[type:flat|dc:17|name:Consumed Poison Metabolizes] check; on a success, this ability ends.
RiF9Uw43dbvL8TEa.name: Consume Poison

TfGlX9oclwIPR62r.description: A poison eater can't gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened} condition from poisons.
TfGlX9oclwIPR62r.name: Toxin-Inured

h2Gw20WY0zHbwAEX.description:
Scorpion venom is excruciating and its effects are somewhat debilitating.

Activate D Interact (Injury)

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:22]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d10[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d10[poison]] damage and enfeebled 1 (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d10[poison]] damage and enfeebled 2 (1 round)

Poisoned Dart Statue.description: Countless poison darts fire from holes in the statues and walls of this hall.
Poisoned Dart Statue.hazardDisable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:34|name:Disable Trap|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) on the control panel deactivates the trap.
Poisoned Dart Statue.hazardReset: The trap deactivates and resets after 1 minute.
Poisoned Dart Statue.hazardRoutine: (1 action) The trap launches one dart against every creature in the hall as 1 action. Because it launches darts continuously, the trap can also use the Continuous Barrage free action (see below) to launch darts at each creature during that creature's turn. The trap doesn't take a multiple attack penalty.
Poisoned Dart Statue.name: Poisoned Dart Statue

b7d4FMN2Fj0m71FK.description: This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.
b7d4FMN2Fj0m71FK.name: Religious Symbol (norgorber)

hwPxq98MdBLlWfAG.description:
These projectiles are the ammunition for bows. The shaft of an arrow is made of wood. It is stabilized in flight by fletching at one end and bears a metal head on the other.

Infused with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Wjkw0lEUOhypYvzo]{Shadow Essence}
hwPxq98MdBLlWfAG.name: Arrows With Shadow Essence

iYdGVR75KvoZWFO3.description: Kalyn can masterfully manipulate vile, poisonous energy and increase its potency. Her melee and ranged Strikes deal an additional 2d6 poison damage, and a target that takes this poison damage has a -1 status penalty to saving throws against Kalyn's divine spells for 1 round. Poisons delivered by Kalyn have the virulent trait.
iYdGVR75KvoZWFO3.name: Toxic Mastery

tF3OooF3TgShCxrF.description: This shortbow is made from horn, wood, and sinew laminated together to increase the power of its pull and the force of its projectile. Its compact size and power make it a favorite of mounted archers. Any time an ability is specifically restricted to a shortbow, it also applies to composite shortbows unless otherwise stated.
tF3OooF3TgShCxrF.name: +1 Striking Composite Shortbow

xZ3ieTwpHIr5Ysgl.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.
xZ3ieTwpHIr5Ysgl.name: +1 Leather Armor

ykHarPFAY9t176Uv.description:
Trigger A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

Effect The monster attempts a melee Strike against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This Strike doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.
ykHarPFAY9t176Uv.name: Attack of Opportunity

Prospecti Statue.description: As with any humanoid animated statues of Medium size, giant animated statues are used to guard locations of importance, but their increased size and power make them most useful in large vaults, spacious chambers, or outdoor locations. Animated objects of this strength and size are ideal for tasks and responsibilities usually performed by golems, and more powerful animated objects are thus all but unheard of.

FHYZijWKqxyPWq4b.description: Like normal objects, a giant animated statue has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once a giant animated statue is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 22.
FHYZijWKqxyPWq4b.name: Construct Armor (Hardness 10)

M203mlcBNFvAqyIJ.description:
The Prospecti statue turns suddenly, causing its robes, which flow like fabric despite being as hard as stone, to swing about and damage opponents.

Creatures adjacent to the animated statue take @Damage[(2d6+6)[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:25|basic:true] save; on a critical failure, the creature is also knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}).
M203mlcBNFvAqyIJ.name: Stone Robes

Prospecti Statue.name: Prospecti Statue

Pulping Golem.description: Traditionally crafted into the forms of giant suits of armor or powerful animals, iron golems are products of exquisite artistry and skill. Their articulated joints and sturdy armored bodies require great care and mathematical precision to craft, and regular cleaning and oiling ensure they don't rust over the ages. With proper care, iron golems can remain in good shape for thousands of years, being passed down for generations, as long as they aren't destroyed by meddlesome adventurers. In addition to their incredible strength, iron golems possess a potent toxic breath weapon that is often more than enough to dispatch entire groups of opponents.

HkUjt1e6CiwdfHoy.description:
The pulping golem spills its cauldron stomach to the floor, dealing @Damage[9d12[fire]] damage to creatures within 10 feet (@Check[type:reflex|dc:33|basic:true] save).

It can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.
HkUjt1e6CiwdfHoy.name: Breath Weapon

RSzJjCjwpz8jIS3J.description:
Any @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained} value from this poison is reduced by 1 every hour.

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:35]

Maximum Duration 4 rounds

Stage 1 2d6+4 poison and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 4d6+4 poison and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 8d6+4 poison and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 3} (1 round).
RSzJjCjwpz8jIS3J.name: Iron Golem Poison

SJraLZmz7x1C04ki.description: Magical rusting effects, like a rust monster's antennae, affect the iron golem normally.
SJraLZmz7x1C04ki.name: Vulnerable to Rust

ZFx4kB8JAYfSX4xr.description: The pulping golem extends its legs up to a height of 40 feet, raising its body high into the air. While its legs are extended, its movement speed is halved, and it takes a -2 penalty to its Fortitude save DC against Shove and Trip attempts.
ZFx4kB8JAYfSX4xr.name: Extend Legs

aMNM0X0dVvVRdlZT.description: Casting @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.SUKaxVZW2TlM8lu0]{Neutralize Poison} on the golem deactivates its Breath Weapon for 1 minute.
aMNM0X0dVvVRdlZT.name: Vulnerable to Neutralize Poison

lYvWF5v5Vah9KWsN.description:
harmed by acid (6d10+4, 2d8+4 from areas and persistent damage); healed by fire (area 2d8+4 HP); slowed by electricity

A golem is immune to spells and magical abilities other than its own, but each type of golem is affected by a few types of magic in special ways. These exceptions are listed in shortened form in the golem's stat block, with the full rules appearing here. If an entry lists multiple types (such as "cold and water"), either type of spell can affect the golem. Harmed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem causes it to take the listed amount of damage (this damage has no type) instead of the usual effect. If the golem starts its turn in an area of magic of this type or is affected by a persistent effect of the appropriate type, it takes the damage listed in the parenthetical. Healed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem makes the golem lose the slowed condition and gain HP equal to half the damage the spell would have dealt. If the golem starts its turn in an area of this type of magic, it gains the HP listed in the parenthetical. Slowed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem causes it to be slowed 1 for [[/br 2d6 #rounds]]{2d6 rounds} instead of the usual effect. If the golem starts its turn in an area of this type of magic, it's slowed 1 for that round. Vulnerable To Each golem is vulnerable to one or more specific spells, with the effects described in its stat block.
lYvWF5v5Vah9KWsN.name: Golem Antimagic

nhz5F428cTKGkc9v.description: The iron golem Strides up to its Speed, pushing back each creature whose space it moves into and damaging them if they try to stop its movement. A creature can attempt to bar the way by succeeding at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:39] save. On a critical success, the resisting creature takes no damage; otherwise, it is damaged as if hit by the golem's fist.
nhz5F428cTKGkc9v.name: Inexorable March

Pulping Golem.name: Pulping Golem

VsMHrDx86310JmtX.description: Ralso deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

aBQGxKqOuBqF1FkF.description:
Requirements Ralso is wielding two piercing weapons

Frequency once per round

Effect Ralso makes two Strikes against a single creature within reach, one Strike per weapon.

These attacks count toward Ralso's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after both attacks.
aBQGxKqOuBqF1FkF.name: Double Stab

bKDnotLHOqr113Bf.description: This ring magically conceals any armor and sheathed weapons you're wearing by either turning them invisible or creating the illusion of ordinary clothes. The ring doesn't change your appearance beyond concealing weapons and armor. As soon as you wield a weapon, the weapon becomes obvious to onlookers and is no longer affected by the ring until you sheathe the weapon for at least 1 minute. A creature can disbelieve this illusion by Seeking or any time it hits you with an attack.

3vUeNTCG7OjIBa45.description:
Requirements The ravenile's regeneration is currently active

The ravenile regains [[/r 20[healing]]] HP.
3vUeNTCG7OjIBa45.name: Forced Regeneration

Av9NysCBnGty9we0.description:
Requirements The ravenile's regeneration is currently deactivated

Effect The ravenile makes a melee Strike.

This counts as two attacks for the ravenile's multiple attack penalty.

If this Strike hits, the ravenile deals an extra die of weapon damage and the target falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.
Av9NysCBnGty9we0.name: Furious Wallop

mOEFev3A3LvUINAz.description: A ravenile can hold their breath for 20 minutes.
mOEFev3A3LvUINAz.name: Deep Breath

2zmTtiyeZNvKPOcI.description:
Reginald's body is filled with toxic ink

Trigger An adjacent creature Strikes Reginald with a melee weapon or unarmed attack and deals damage

Effect The creature is exposed to Reginald's poison ink.
2zmTtiyeZNvKPOcI.name: Ink Blood

3dd754R1VUxFyZiT.description: If a creature with less than 5 Secret Knowledge points reduces Reginald to 0 HP (or dealt the last damage to him before he dies from using Overdrive Engine), Reginald's body dissipates into a puddle of ink and releases a black wave of psychic energy. Each creature within 30 feet is bathed in a torrent of forbidden secrets and gains 1 Secret Knowledge point. Reginald's body reforms [[/br 1d6 #rounds]]{1d6 rounds} later in his sanctum at full health at a location of his choosing (typically the Pool of Secrets, area L11). This ability activates automatically with no action necessary on Vancaskerkin's behalf.
3dd754R1VUxFyZiT.name: Secret of Rebirth

5inXNyZGoLUMii53.description: With his body composed of ink and gears, Reginald can move through tight spaces as if he were a Tiny creature, treating them as difficult terrain.
5inXNyZGoLUMii53.name: Slither

KOfo0zVfgBhhWGjT.description: Reginald is equipped with a cannon and hundreds of steel quills. He makes two steel quill attacks against every creature in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60], ignoring the multiple attack penalty until after all attacks are made. He can't use Quill Cannon again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Quill Cannon]]{1d4 rounds}.
KOfo0zVfgBhhWGjT.name: Quill Cannon

OF5xPm4it251t0zo.description: Reginald engages his defensive plating, which casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.OOELvfkTedBMlWtq]{Spell Turning} on him (counteract modifier +32).
OF5xPm4it251t0zo.name: Reflective Plating

V3S7DLZ4aWxgcg1R.description:
Reginald is immune to the toxic ink that flows through his veins

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:38]

Maximum Duration 10 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[3d6[poison]] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[4d6[poison]] @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} (1 round).
V3S7DLZ4aWxgcg1R.name: Poison Ink

pJcNWcLAWBXtvefA.description: Each time Reginald is reborn in his lair, his machines graft him with a new clockwork modification. He chooses one of his abilities with the clockwork trait. He gains access to this ability but can't use any of his other clockwork abilities. He can't choose the same ability twice in a row. He begins with Ink Blood active.
pJcNWcLAWBXtvefA.name: Clockwork Reconstruction

rlZ9VxWPwn9XfGgL.description: Reginald's lungs are equipped with ink canisters, allowing him to spew a @Template[type:line|distance:60] of ink that deals @Damage[9d6[poison]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:39|basic:true] save; on a failure, the creature is also subjected to Reginald's poison ink).
rlZ9VxWPwn9XfGgL.name: Breath Weapon

zaQRIy856WuUiHBw.description:
Reginald is equipped with clockwork organs to power his body

Requirements Reginald has 175 Hit Points or fewer

Effect Reginald gains 200 temporary Hit Points, a +15-foot status bonus to Speed, and a +2 status bonus to melee attack rolls. His body begins to overheat, spewing steam that deals @Damage[9d6[fire]] damage at the beginning of his turn to all creatures within @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:40|basic:true] save). After 2 rounds, Reginald explodes, dealing @Damage[19d6[fire]] damage to all creatures within @Template[type:emanation|distance:60]{60 feet} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:40|basic:true] save). Reginald dies. For the purposes of his Secret of Rebirth ability, the last creature to damage Reginald counts as killing him.
zaQRIy856WuUiHBw.name: Overdrive Engine

1cQlKfzWAd8gXGFa.description:
The rhevanna can target celestials with their @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.GYmXvS9NJ7QwfWGg]{Bind Soul} ability, and a gem containing a celestial bound by a rhevanna has Hardness 40.

If the rhevanna destroys a gem in which they placed a celestial, the celestial is destroyed forever.
1cQlKfzWAd8gXGFa.name: Malefic Binding

II1iKHEPt0qdurXn.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:60]{60 feet} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

When a healing effect restores Hit Points to a non-fiend creature in the aura, the amount of Hit Points restored is halved. The rhevanna gains temporary Hit Points equal to the amount of Hit Points restored.

The rhevanna loses any remaining temporary Hit Points after 1 minute.
II1iKHEPt0qdurXn.name: Plunder Life

JnTr0G2JvwVYzdfR.description:
Frequency once per round

Trigger The rhevanna hits a creature with a weapon Strike

Effect The rhevanna casts an innate @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.ksLCg62cLOojw3gN]{Dimensional Anchor} spell on the creature.
JnTr0G2JvwVYzdfR.name: Detaining Strike

SMwhRQyOrogJbUal.description:
Trigger The rhevanna kills a living creature of at least 16th level

Effect The rhevanna drinks the triggering creature's life force and regains [[/r 40[healing]]]{40 Hit Points}. If the triggering creature is a celestial, the rhevanna instead regains [[/r 80[healing]]]{80 Hit Points}.
SMwhRQyOrogJbUal.name: Lifedrinker

Rhevanna.name: Rhevanna
Rhevanna.npcAllSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Rigged Cubby.description: A hidden string connected to precariously stacked bricks causes the cubby to collapse in on itself when the string is pulled.
Rigged Cubby.hazardDisable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:20|name:Cut String|traits:action:disable-a-device] to cut the string without setting off the trap
Rigged Cubby.name: Rigged Cubby

Ba9gUN2kmGTDwJ7v.description: Sad Liza Strides three times. Once per Stride, she can attempt a war razor Strike against a creature in her reach at any point during the Stride; she must make each Strike against a different creature, but she doesn't apply her multiple attack penalty until after making all her Strikes. If any of the Strikes are a critical failure, Bloody Mayhem immediately ends.
Ba9gUN2kmGTDwJ7v.name: Bloody Mayhem

BwXqyvY8ZxaJq5Iw.description: Sad Liza deals an additional 3d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} targets.

DfCLdl3RYkGdmNgR.description:
This string of beads appears to be a hemp string with lustrous red beads of various sizes hanging from it. When activated, it briefly appears in its true form: a golden chain with golden spheres attached by fine threads.

This necklace has one @Damage[16d6[fire]] damage, three @Damage[14d6[fire]] damage and four @Damage[12d6[fire]] damage beads with a Reflex save DC of 36. When all the beads are gone, the necklace becomes a non-magical hemp string.

Activate A Interact

Effect You detach a sphere from the necklace, causing it to glow with orange light. After you activate a sphere, if you or anyone else hurls it (an Interact action with the ranged trait), it detonates as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.sxQZ6yqTn0czJxVd]{Fireball} where it lands. Your toss can place the center of the fireball anywhere within 70 feet, though at the GM's discretion you might need to make an attack roll if the throw is unusually challenging. If no one hurls the sphere by the start of your next turn, it turns into a non-magical red bead.
DfCLdl3RYkGdmNgR.name: Necklace of Fireballs VI

NvOUKM0pOaTFyrWw.description: Whenever Sad Liza deals slashing damage, the target takes an additional 2d10 persistent bleed damage.
NvOUKM0pOaTFyrWw.name: Close Cutter

aV20X0Mp1CqH1tqz.description: Sad Liza makes three ranged dagger Strikes, each against a separate target; she ignores the multiple attack penalty until after making all three Strikes. On a critical hit, the target takes @Damage[2d10[bleed]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round.
aV20X0Mp1CqH1tqz.name: Fan of Daggers

aZlGemIJeXm9jJEE.description: Sad Liza's ranged dagger Strikes have a range increment of 20 feet instead of 10 feet.
aZlGemIJeXm9jJEE.name: Knife Thrower

fer5YKRtixZJgTUl.description: This leather armor is reinforced with metal studs and sometimes small metal plates, providing most of the flexibility of leather armor with more robust protection.
fer5YKRtixZJgTUl.name: +2 Resilient Studded Leather Armor

oEHGOxor2V2wjqVL.description: A war razor is an exaggerated version of the barbers' tool. It is a brittle but extremely sharp weapon that is very easy to slip into a pocket or sleeve.
oEHGOxor2V2wjqVL.name: +2 Greater Striking War Razor

Vw3bmxYidV4ocAb1.description:
Frequency once per day

Requirements Scathka hasn't acted yet on their turn

Effect On their turn, Scathka casts one spell they've prepared and already cast this day without spending a spell slot. Scathka must still Cast the Spell and meet the spell's other requirements.
Vw3bmxYidV4ocAb1.name: Drain Wand

eIDlmbUtMfTc108y.description:
Requirement Scathka is wielding a dagger

Effect Scathka draws a shadowy glyph on the dagger's blade and flings it at a nearby foe. Scathka makes a ranged Strike with the dagger with the range increment to 30 feet.

If the Strike hits, it deals @Damage[8d6[cold]] damage (double damage on a critical success) and the target must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:32] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} until the end of its next turn (or [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} on a critical failure).

The dagger loses its shadowy magic as soon as the attack is resolved.
eIDlmbUtMfTc108y.name: Throw Shadow Blade

7HvTKcBHlvslLf1z.description: This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.
7HvTKcBHlvslLf1z.name: Religious Symbol of Norgorber

FXTugA9GorPxMpXh.description: Velberi designates one creature she can see within 30 feet as an apostate to the church of Norgorber, regardless of the creature's actual religious leanings. She can have up to four apostates designated at a time; any additional apostate removes another apostate of her choice. Velberi treats all Perception checks made to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1xRFPTFtWtGJ9ELw]{Sense Motive} against an apostate as one degree of success better, and her Strikes deal an additional 2d8 mental damage to apostates.
FXTugA9GorPxMpXh.name: Designate Apostate

JABmfDIIkLC6Isuf.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.
JABmfDIIkLC6Isuf.name: +2 Striking Dagger

Secret-Keeper.name: Secret-Keeper
Secret-Keeper.npcAllSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. mental

7GSRG0kO6Z9IWhXQ.description:
Trigger A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

Effect The monster attempts a melee Strike against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This Strike doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.
7GSRG0kO6Z9IWhXQ.name: Attack of Opportunity

7biZlvn3vY2e7oEj.description:
Trigger A shatterling takes non-bludgeoning damage and there's an unbroken mirror at least 1 foot wide within 100 feet of the shatterling

Effect The nearest mirror to the shatterling at least 1 foot wide breaks, and the damage to the shatterling is reduced to 0.
7biZlvn3vY2e7oEj.name: Divert Strike

D27lYuRNmEYB5vjo.description: The shatterling touches a broken mirror, instantly repairing it.
D27lYuRNmEYB5vjo.name: Wipe Away Cracks

K2NRmCiVWR4uMsRg.description: The shatterling doesn't appear in reflective surfaces if it doesn't want to. When it's within 100 feet of an unbroken mirror at least 1 foot wide, a shatterling can Hide and Sneak even without cover or without being concealed.
K2NRmCiVWR4uMsRg.name: Vanish in Reflections

OESsshXWIJSX1LE7.description: If the shatterling attempts an Intimidation check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} a target within 30 feet of a creature with persistent bleed damage, the shatterling has +4 circumstance bonus to the Intimidation check. In addition, the shatterling takes no penalty to the check for not speaking a language the target can hear, and the target isn't temporarily immune to the shatterling's attempts to Demoralize it unless the shatterling critically fails its Intimidation check.
OESsshXWIJSX1LE7.name: Blood-Fueled Titter

X8bVkdHSJwnQfIoj.description: A shatterling can see and hear through any unbroken mirror within 100 feet.
X8bVkdHSJwnQfIoj.name: Mirror Senses

gczvNivaLBoVgpla.description: During this Stride, the shatterling can move into any unbroken mirror at least 1 foot wide and out of another unbroken mirror at least 1 foot wide within 100 feet of the first mirror, treating the mirrors as connected. The shatterling can move through any number of pairs of foot-wide mirrors during its mirror jump, requiring each pair to be within 100 feet of each other while doing so.
gczvNivaLBoVgpla.name: Mirror Jump

nqTM0MryJthdq3ZY.description: A shatterling gains an additional reaction each turn, but can use this extra reaction only for Divert Strike.
nqTM0MryJthdq3ZY.name: Extra Reaction

1qQjPJIus3hZOUXY.description:
The Shikwashim mercenary makes a melee Strike. If it hits, it deals an extra die of damage.

This counts as two attacks for the mercenary's multiple attack penalty.
1qQjPJIus3hZOUXY.name: Powerful Swipe

3N2FHMvzMRnvpsId.description: A Shikwashim mercenary's multiple attack penalty for attacks against humans is -3 (-2 with an agile weapon) on their second attack per turn or -6 (-4 with an agile weapon) on their third or subsequent attack per turn.
3N2FHMvzMRnvpsId.name: Human Hunter

3hoeSfakad2dxcKN.description:
Activate1 Interact

After you drink this elixir, your sight becomes sharper in darkness. You gain darkvision for 1 hour.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.bcxVvIbuZWOvsKcA]{Effect: Darkvision Elixir (Moderate)}

7qqes4mzlHueunJX.description: A Shikwashim mercenary can hold their breath for 20 minutes.
7qqes4mzlHueunJX.name: Deep Breath

ISXykb5wK1DoaIOw.description: Non-lizardfolk creatures in difficult terrain and non-lizardfolk creatures that are in water and lack a Swim speed are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to a Shikwashim mercenary.
ISXykb5wK1DoaIOw.name: Terrain Advantage

SGQATSbzafV9SYlH.description:
With a sharp whistle or wave of their hand, the mercenary distracts an opponent so one of the mercenary's allies can land a clean blow.

The mercenary chooses a target and an ally, both of whom must be within 30 feet of the mercenary. The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the first Strike the mercenary's ally makes on its next turn; if the ally doesn't Strike that target, the effect is lost.

Depending on how the mercenary distracts their foe, this action gains either the auditory or visual trait.
SGQATSbzafV9SYlH.name: Coordinated Distraction

fvr1IlwjlQYM3Nr9.description:
Though they come in a variety of shapes and sizes, the protection offered by wooden shields comes from the stoutness of their materials. While wooden shields are less expensive than steel shields, they break more easily.

Hardness HP BT
3 12 6

3g9fOfW6T5VklwH5.description: When a shredskin successfully @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.kMcV8e5EZUxa6evt]{Squeezes}, it moves through the tight space at full speed. Narrow confines are not difficult terrain for a shredskin.
3g9fOfW6T5VklwH5.name: Compression

DGsILrvl3LJIeZIu.description:
Requirements The shredskin is grabbing a creature

Effect The shredskin attempts to pin the creature and wrap itself around the creature like a shirt. The shredskin rolls an @Check[type:athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the creature's Fortitude DC.

On a success, the creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} and the shredskin can take control of the creature as if using Control Body.

At the start of its turn, the shredskin can automatically Constrict the enshrouded creature as a free action.

An enshrouded creature can attempt a DC 16 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} check to break free (DC 18 if the shredskin critically succeeded its Athletics check to Enshroud).
DGsILrvl3LJIeZIu.name: Enshroud

QozBQD2QZP7kMYOG.description:
Requirements The shredskin is adjacent to a Medium or Small humanoid-shaped corpse

Effect The shredskin wraps itself around the corpse and takes control of the host body. While controlling a host, the shredskin uses the host's Speed but its own attacks, and it loses its Grab and Enshroud abilities.

Attacks that target the shredskin while it controls a body deal half of the damage to the shredskin and half of the damage to the host body. Attacks that target an area deal damage to both the shredskin and host body normally.

The shredskin can release the host body as a free action at the start of its turn. If the host is destroyed, the shredskin automatically releases the body and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} for 1 round. A Medium corpse typically has 15 hit points, while a Small corpse typically has 10 Hit Points.

Creatures can notice that a corpse is controlled by a shredskin by succeeding a Perception check against the shredskin's Deception DC.
QozBQD2QZP7kMYOG.name: Control Body

1a9J9jdVUsp4RIxQ.description:
Shristi enters a combat stance perfected by past champions of the Challenge of Sky and Heaven. While in this stance, the only Strikes Shristi can make are skyward slash unarmed attacks. These deal 1d10 slashing damage; are in the brawling group; and have the nonlethal, unarmed, and versatile P traits.

While in Sky and Heaven Stance, Shristi gains resistance 2 to electricity and sonic damage.
1a9J9jdVUsp4RIxQ.name: Sky and Heaven Stance

4nrWl1NPbkOzx2Nq.name: Victor's Medallion from the Challenge of Sky and Heaven

7PJ0xQKU3T5EtaPW.description:
Frequency twice per day

Effect With a loud shout, Shristi unleashes his ki as a crackling shroud of thunder and lightning that engulfs his body. Until the end of his next turn, Shristi's unarmed Strikes and Strikes with weapons that have the monk trait deal an additional 3 electricity damage and 3 sonic damage.
7PJ0xQKU3T5EtaPW.name: Heaven's Thunder

UylfhYpRBAz42DrH.description:
Shristi makes two unarmed Strikes. If both hit the same creature, combine their damage for the purposes of resistances and weaknesses. He applies his multiple attack penalty to the Strikes normally.

As it has the flourish trait, Shristi can use Flurry of Blows only once per turn.
UylfhYpRBAz42DrH.name: Flurry of Blows

SoEJRrsphmHa4aoG.description:
When a siege shard is destroyed within 100 feet of a structure, it reforms after [[/br 2d4 #days]] days within the nearest structure, fully healed.

A siege shard within a structure can permanently destroyed by the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.adventure-specific-actions.Item.QW2gYIKce3W31xXf]{Prove Peace} activity.
SoEJRrsphmHa4aoG.name: Rejuvenation

UYn0m6msQksZeSqS.description:
Mental damage ignores a siege shard's hardness.

Additionally, proving the siege shard's generative conflict is over with the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Ma93dpT4K7JbP9gu]{Prove Peace} activity reverts the creature to ordinary stone.
UYn0m6msQksZeSqS.name: Exorcism

g67xAp632gfQapHl.description:
Frequency once per minute

Effect The siege shard emits a disorienting psychic blast. All creatures within a 15 feet emanation take @Damage[4d6[mental]] damage (@Check[type:will|dc:20|basic:true] save).
g67xAp632gfQapHl.name: Overwhelming Anguish

jcfMZ2vEUL2nEfFQ.description: While a siege shard is embedded within a structure while using @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.vh1RpbWfqdNC4L3P]{One with Stone}, the structure and all objects within it take twice as long to repair.
jcfMZ2vEUL2nEfFQ.name: Surreptitious Siege

3aasDsiXoE4xtSVZ.description: Skebs can use creatures that are at least one size larger than themself as cover for the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} actions.
3aasDsiXoE4xtSVZ.name: Distracting Shadows

ZEbYuhDFGc3fADE1.description: Skebs deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

O19b688nMXlfxdQP.description:
Frequency once per round

Requirement You are wielding two melee weapons, each in a different hand.

Effect You swiftly attack your hunted prey with both weapons. Make two Strikes against a creature, one with each of the required weapons. If both hit the same creature, combine their damage for the purpose of its resistances and weaknesses. Apply your multiple attack penalty to each Strike normally.
O19b688nMXlfxdQP.name: Twin Takedown

fPhaooKcxBRh5Bsx.description: When attacking an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creature, the Skinsaw murderer deals 1d6 additional precision damage.

oTAvDxUMpEcP9vfn.description:
A patchwork of humanoid flesh makes up this grotesque mask stitched together with black silk or wire. It is distinctive for its bulbous orange eye- crafted from a magical glass bauble-and wide row of teeth.

When worn, the mask amplifies your ability to sense fear in other creatures.

You automatically know the value of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} condition of any @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.1wQY3JYyhMYeeV2G]{Observed} creature, and you gain a +1 item bonus to Perception checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} frightened creatures. Whenever you deal precision damage to a frightened creature, you deal 1 additional precision damage.

If you are not evil, you are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} while wearing theSkinsaw mask.

MvGg9ZU03PHCDYj9.description:
Requirements The Skinsaw seamer is currently grappling a creature

Effect The seamer stitches a piece of cloth to the creature's arm, face, or leg, potentially hindering it. The creature must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:26|traits:damaging-effect] saving throw; if the seamer has already successfully used their Flay ability against the creature within the past minute, the creature's save result is one degree of success worse.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes @Damage[1d4[piercing]] damage.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} (seamer's choice).
